Glad I tried it, loved the chicken skins, but a little pricey for what you receive for my taste but it is a Kerry Simon restaurant. If you go for lunch go early - they fill up fast with the downtown work crowd. If there are only two of you expect to be seated at the communal area.

High marks for flavor of the food however the staff needs to get an understanding of good hygiene while in the food service industry. 

This was my second time having a late lunch here. This time around the bartender seemed to be the waiter at all the tables so he was needless to say "very busy" we were created and seated promptly by the hostess. As we sat the bartender is passing behind us and mudders to hisself f@$k, I'm guessing because he was so busy. The hostess got us some waters and said that the waiter would be with us. About 5 minutes pass and he comes by says hello and asked if we were ready. 

I ordered an iced tea and the other person with me asked for raspberry iced tea he responded in an almost annoyed fashion I don't have raspberry iced tea, so we order lemonade. We order a starter and two other main dishes. 

The shrimp platter came out first which was a main dish followed about 3 minutes later with the gyro tacos which was the starter and then about 5 minutes later the turkey burger which was the other main dish. Seems the waiter should ask and deliver instructions to the kitchen so guests get the food as they are expecting. 

My main concern was the hygiene the hostess was trying to help out the waiter by delivering some food and helping with drinks however the almost to the crotch shorts seemed to be causing her a problem so she had to keep reaching to her inner thigh and pulling them down. The other was which seemed to be a manager figure wearing a button down shirt and sweatpants, he would play with his mustache and sole patch rub his eyes and face then grab a plate from the kitchen and deliver it to a table. The other lady at the kitchen counter did a good job as well as the kitchen staff. The other manager figure there delivered one of our plates to us and was very professional. 

The food is a little over priced however great marks on flavor so great job to the kitchen staff. 

The employees and managers should be a little more mindful of cleanliness. 

Would like to come back but would need a very good reason as there are other establishments to spend my money.

Espetacular! Depois de 20 dias viajando por San Francisco, Los Angeles e Vegas, indo em restaurantes muito bem avaliados, posso dizer que esse foi o melhor disparado. O lugar fica a 3 milhas do burburinho e parece ser menos frequentado por turistas. A decoração descontraída pode afugentar que está com crianças, mas não desista, pois vale muito a pena inclusive para quem vai em família. Comida de primeira em Las Vegas.
So good. It's a hidden gem in downtown LV. It's a little pricey, but worth the spurge. I especially loved how the staff is passionate about the food.

I was in Las Vegas for business, and found this place on yelp while searching for a good burger. I walked in and very surprised by how small it was inside. This didn't in any way detract from my experience. It was clean and well decorated, and the service was attentive. I made the odd decision to have a glass of Pinot Noir with my burger. Somehow it worked. I ordered the Butter Burger, and it was cooked medium well as I requested. The burger was long on flavor, and I thoroughly enjoyed it, and the spicy tater tots on the side were hot, crisp and tasty. I was in and out in half hour and had a very pleasant meal. Recommended.

Trendy place located downtown Las Vegas.  Fun plates tapas style to share if you are having lunch.  I didn't have dinner there yet but it is on my list of places for dinner.  Being that I am a big fan of Kerry Simon, I can't say one thing negative.  It was good food, reasonably priced and fun atmosphere.  We sat at the bar that surrounded the prep area.  I would definitely recommend this to the tourist visiting the area as well as the locals.

Great, energetic staff!  Creative and delicious menu items. We had the bacon jam, mac and cheese, veal meatballs, duck flatbread, butter burger, brownie with bacon ice cream, and glazed donut bread pudding for dessert. None are exactly low calorie but all were sooooo worth it.  A really fun and tasty experience all around. We'll definitely be returning with more people. Love this little spot!!

Genuinely tasty. Small but articulate menu, with everything done with love and satisfaction. The ambiance was a fabulous break from the strip and the staff was amicable and pleasant. I will be back when traveling. It's well worth it. Mac and cheese was delicious, shrimp and grits was spicy and flavorful. I highly recommend

Words can not express how much I love this place or how much I look forward to going back. The food is so good! The atmosphere is awesome. 
We ordered the deviled eggs- you have to try then
The bacon jam w Brie- soo much jam too little bread but so good!
The cocktails are awesome!!!

This is my favorite restaurant on Las Vegas. I've tried both lunch and  dinner menus and find both selections are absolutely delicious. The staff is always friendly and attentive. My favorite dish is the bread pudding!
Try it ,you'll love it...hand-crafted approachable food made with great care. Call and tell the hostess you are on the way to get on the list for a table...only takes reservations for six.
Amazing food! Atmosphere was great as well and the service is top notch. I would definitely recommend the bacon jam and baked mac n cheese.  Check it out!

We arrived without a reservation.  Two dining and were led to open bar seats next to the prep area of an open kitchen.  We loved the Decore, and the service.  They were instantly pouring water and asking for drink orders while suggesting options.  They explained the breakdown of the menu which was easy to understand.  We had a few choices that were all delicious.  We can highly recommend the food and service, but would ask for a different seat next time to see if that wasn't more comfortable.  We will go back on our next visit.

Baked macaroni, Pig and Fig, Devil eggs with carviar, and the chicken sandwich were all delicious. The only concerns were the servers wearing civilian clothes. I just don't feel like flagging them down to take my orders. Plus, I don't even know which ones are servers or customers. It's pretty bad to mistakenly call someone and thinking they could be one of the servers. Maybe a uniform polo shirts for everyone? And also, Chefs could at least use a hair mask at least. But, overall, I liked the food and the ambiance.
Burnt ends. Yum. Filet. Yum. Grown up grilled cheese. Yum. Sangria. Yum. Mac and cheese. Yum Food was a 5. Service was meh.
Absolutely love this place. Great food with great service!  (Thank you Courtney). Highly recommend
Loved this place. Great food - veal meatballs are amazing. Cauliflower wonderful too. Everything at the surrounding tables looked fabulous- especially the tempura green beans. Fair prices too.

Today was my first visit to Carson Kitchen. The waitstaff was excellent, but the food was just A-OK. As my rating indicates, nothing was terrible but also nothing was truly outstanding.  Two of us ordered crispy fried chicken skin, shepherd pie, roasted beets, and wild mushroom flatbread. The fried chicken skin seemed a little on the burnt side of fried. The roasted beets were well seasoned and tasty with crumbled blue cheese but were unevenly cooked with some pieces undercooked and crunchy, and some perfectly cooked. And the mushroom flatbread should be called vegetable flatbread since there were other veggies (asparagus and broccoli) in equal parts to the mushrooms; this overall was a little bland and could use some kind of seasoning, maybe some garlic or spices. I had high hopes based on others' reviews but don't share the enthusiasm after my visit.
Yes, it's that good. I thought the service was a little "snooty". But they deserve to have their nose in the air a bit. This is a place I would love to go back to.

A couple of my friends have been raving about this place; so my buddy and I decided to give it a try today.   Ugh!  Never again!  The place is small and loud.  Initially, we were seated at a high top table with strangers.  I didn't want my neighbors to hear our conversation; so we asked to move.  No problem said the hostess.  We struggled to find something to order off the menu.  Tried the bacon jam since it has gotten rave reviews.  It was okay--not something to write home about.  I ordered the fried chicken sandwich.  Hated the spread on the sandwich and not impressed with the chicken.  Enjoyed the tater tots.  My friend ordered the beef stroganoff.  Neither one of us finished our meal and we both declined to have any of it boxed up.  $50.00 not well spent for today's lunch.  Carson Kitchen is busy; so I doubt they will be missing our business in the future.  It's a hip place, but I'd rather be well fed and square.

A great spot in Downtown Las Vegas. I love the atmosphere. Service has been great the three times I went. Loved the Mac and Cheese. Had the Fried Green Tomato sandwich every time because... I might be addicted. 

I tried a few cocktails as well and each was great. 

Great for date night, friend dinners, or dining alone at the bar. I want to go back on a weekend to enjoy the upstairs patio when it's open.

We went for a birthday dinner, little larger group (12 people or so).  Cool atmosphere, the food was great.  A lot of flavor, loved the Gyro Tacos, could've kept eating it all night.  I had the NY Strip Steak, great sear, great flavor, good cut, Fingerling potatoes were really good too.  The only things I wasn't too fond of was the Old Fashioned they made (waaaaaay too much club soda) and felt they were understaffed.
Other than that, everything was great and would really recommend it and will definitely come back.

I went for the first time with my husband last night and we really enjoyed it! The food was good and the bread pudding is a must! The waitress ( young blond girl) was really nice and always smiling! We got to seat near the kitchen and it was cool to see them working on the different plates. The ambiance is really nice, really reminded us of Portland. Nice to see other restaurants that we enjoy that are not on the strip! We need more places like this!
Incredible food, great atmosphere, friendly staff. The bread pudding is stupid good, best I've ever had.
Awesome vibe and great food. Didn't feel like Vegas at all.. No gaming in the establishment... A must see in DT Vegas.

Everything solid: fried chicken skins with honey were smoky and really awesome, gyro tacos had tons of flavor (and came 3 large tacos to an order, waaayyy more food than we were expecting), roasted beet salad with orange and pistachio and some microgreens, and pork belly carbonara which came with corkscrew pasta and what appeared to be a flash-fried egg yolk, still gooey on the inside but cool texture outside. 

If it gives you a sense, the carbonara was our least favorite of the 4 dishes, and it was still pretty good. Other friends think the carbonara is the best dish on the menu. Seriously, everything is great here. Bill was $41, and it was definitely too much food for the two of us. And the location is phenomenal for a night out, and there's a rooftop bar with heaters and blankets for winter. I'm sure it's great in the summer as well.

Update: have tried several other dishes since first trip. Not crazy about the bacon jam, but again, others LOVE the bacon jam, so YMMV. Still highly recommend, nothing bad to say at all. Service is great as well.

Ate here last night with a group of friends celebrating a birthday and this place certainly did not disappoint. Between 8 of us we shared an order of Gyro Taco's, Bacon Jam, BBQ Burnt Ends, Sea bass, NY Strip, Black Rice Oxtail Risotto, and the Crispy Chicken Skins w/ Honey. Then my best friend and I split the Butter Burger. Everything was absolutely delicious. I could have done without the Chicken Skins, but other than that, everything was incredibly flavorful, decent portion sizes to reflect the price, very friendly servers who were very knowledgeable about each item on the menu. (Bianca was our server). The atmosphere of this place is so relaxing. It's a smaller place, making it more intimate and calm. Awesome lighting and decor. Can't wait to go back!

Beyond best service. I wish I remembered our waitress's name. She was awesome. The food was amazing. We got the burnt ends, the pig and fig flatbread and the burger. Everything was delicious. I had to toss two piece of the flatbread because we didn't have a fridge. I almost cried.

Such a diamond to discover in downtown.  The ambiance is rustic and inviting.  The food is excellent, socially the mac n cheese and tater tots! The quaint and cool vibe is matched by the eclectic comfort food menu offerings.  The portions are right and I'm always impressed when I leave.  This is my go-to in downtown for a client lunch or dinner with friends:-)

Thank you Yelp for helping us find the best downtowns restaurant! The food is unique and delicious; love the social plate concept. Manager Michael Martinez and server Roman made certain our experience would be a highlight of our time in Las Vegas. Don't miss the opportunity to try this gem, and say hello to Michael from the Carters! #michaelmartinez #bourbonfudgebrowniebrownbuttericecream

Food was fantastic! Menu is small and everything they make is cooked to perfection. The atmosphere is super casual and comfortable. Great place for sharing plates. If I lived here I would come once a week!

I'm a Vegas local and this hands down my favorite place in town. Whenever friends come to town, this is where we go. 

Bianca did a great job. She even knew the gluten free options for my friend! 

The atmosphere is really fun. The entire place is pretty small so it creates an energy when it's full. The food is amazing! Haven't tried anything I haven't liked. The Turkey Burger is probably my favorite.

I love Downtown Las Vegas, I live Downtown. I have heard good and bad about Carson Kitchen. I waited almost a year before i ate here...and I was incredibly disappointed. Waited forever to get a table, and then was disrespected by staff...  Honestly, the menu is so limited, as a lactose intolerant diner, i could barely find anything on the menu. When i did, it was so awful it was hard to swallow. Seriously i cannot recommend this place to annyone...which sucks because I love downtown, I have been here for 3 years, push downtown to naysayers...and this place just made me embarrassed. Im sorry. I love downtown, but i cannot put my money into this place.

Can't say enough good things about this place. The food was ridiculously great, good variety, flavor, taste, presentation, also the drinks are solid as well.

Definitely wasn't expecting this to be as great as it was. I would suggest this to anyone who is looking for a great meal and good vibe.

My go to downtown spot. Everything on the menu is good but they have the best Mac & Cheese in LV! You have to try this! 

The sign they have in their window calling out the people behind them towing cars is also very Las Vegas! LOVE IT!

Disgusting, overrated and overpriced.  I was horribly shocked at how small, dark, and seemingly dirty this place is.  The service was slow and the food was flavorless and overpriced and way overpriced for the quality snd quantity received.  Apparently they are trying to profit from the reputation of the now deceased Chef Kerry Simon, but I doubt he'd be pleased with this place either.  Save some money and go to Eat, just down the block, or any of a myriad of better, less expensive restaurants on Fremont Street instead.

Food is really good. Major complaint is the hostess and front of house. Just terrible customer interaction. They are busy enough to not care anymore for service. It doesn't sit well. Hopefully management gets on this otherwise this place is going to slide. Too bad because kitchen is great!!

Great new addition to the DTLV dining scene! Had dinner with a party of 8 at CK so we got to try a lot of the menu. Overall, the food was really good. Some highlights were the tempura green beans, the mac & cheese, the deviled eggs, the bacon jam, and the broccoli. The mushroom flatbread and the beet salad were fine and the spam croquettes were very salty (but cleverly presented). The gyro tacos were tasty and filling. Service was solid - at times inattentive but it was pretty busy. Only real drawback was how loud it was. Music turned up too high. in sum, definitely recommend it.

I'm very pleased to have received a response from the business owner after my concerns were stated. Seeing that he obviously cares about my feedback and customer service and will surely be seeing more of me in the future

I've only been here once, but plan to visit again soon. I ordered the Sliders with sweet potato fries and it was absolutely delicious. They were a bit full when I arrived, so I ended up sitting at the bar and got a nice view of the entire kitchen. The place is actually really tiny, so there can be a bit of a wait sometimes. The food is EXCELLENT. It's near downtown, but there are plenty of parking spots around this place. You may need to put in a quarter or two at the nearby meter though.

We came here after getting a recommendation from a friend. This place is off the typical tourist path and reminds me of something you would find in Phoenix. We sat at the bar and the bartender was friendly. The fried shrimp which is lightly tossed in a tasty creamy sauce and topped with sliced fresh chillies was my favorite. We also got lamb tacos and the strawberry walnut manchego salad. I'm not giving this place five stars because the greens in the salad were starting to wilt snd didn't taste fresh.

This food was amazing!! The Bacon Jam and Butter Burger were perfect for sharing. I can see when the Butter Burger is award winning. Super friendly staff and loved watching the chefs! This is my new favorite Vegas restaurant for sure!

Chill little spot with a nice, moder-hipster build out. Simple menu with an exotic twist to some top notch culinary favorites. Great service with beautiful ladies taking care of each and every guest on a more personable level then most places.

Let me gather my thoughts... It's difficult to paraphrase an explosive experience on a full stomach. Ok I'll start from beginning to end. We got there and parking was difficult, greeter at the door was nice, super packed, 45 minute wait, ordered a beer at the bar, waited in the back courtyard. Now this seems rather unpleasant, but this is where Carson Kitchen 'stepped their game up' and delivered. At the bar they had a Brooklyn Brown Ale that my friends and I enjoy and haven't seen here in the west coast. The court yard in the back was surprisingly serene, reminiscent of times spent in a backyard BBQ with friends. The wait was actually 15 mins which translated to 'freaking awesome' (I like the under-promising and over-delivering). Now, the fifth star was credited to the food and the man behind the magic. Bacon Jam is on point and that is no understatement because I found myself spreading that goodness on everything. No joke. I put it on the Mac n cheese, I put it on the gyro tacos, I put it on the coco steak. Don't get me wrong, all of these dishes lacked nothing and were incredible by themselves, but that bacon jam was like crack for me, and given the means I would've taken it intravenously. I guess one of the chefs came out to check on us and he couldn't have been a more 'cool like dat' kind of guy. Kudos to Eugene the chef, you made that food your bitch and owned it. Not quite sure who the owner is but you get the standing 'O' for nailing the whole ambiance of this place. You seriously got that five star taste without all that pretension of those snotty, over priced, mish-mash, upscale casino restaurants. Most def coming back here and referring it to my friends and family.

If you want a low key quiet evening out, this place is not for you.  It's small, cramped, and busy.  The staff is nice enough, but they just seem to be in a hurry.  So if you have those expectations, you'll like the place.  

The food is pretty good, but rich.  The restaurant kinda reminds me of a gastro pub without the beer taps.  Everything I had was flavor packed and unique.  I had the black rice and oxtail risotto, fried chicken skins, bacon jam, and the watermelon feta salad.  All good, and very rich.  I think the food was giving me gout afterwards.  BTW, I shared the plates, I didn't eat all those dishes myself.

There's a patio in the back that you can wait in while you're waiting for a table.  It's open, so it was about 150 degrees out there.  I ordered a beer and took it out there, but it went warm rather quickly.  Maybe you get use to the dry heat if you live in Vegas?

They don't take reservations, but they set the waiting time expectations really well.  People seem to be willing to wait to get a spot in this place.  Try it once.

The beer and wine selection was small but well done.  I think they should add a couple more verities of beer on the menu though.

The food is amazing. Every item order was perfectly flavored. Lots of feel good food options. The atmosphere is what got me though. It was a chilly night to be out dining rooftop. I thought if only I had a blanket this place would be perfect. Guess what...they have blankets!! Love it, cant wait to come back!
Yes to BACON JELLY, yes to FRIED CHICKEN SKINS, yes to Mac & cheese. A really good place for foodies to get a great fix!

This place is a must if you're in Vegas. My husband and I sat at the kitchen bar (dangerous!) and I couldn't stop ordering food! They put so much love and effort into everything they make. At first, I was a little turned off by the seating. I felt like I was in the kitchen, but very quickly realized we had the best spot in the house. 

I had 2 of their hand crafted cocktails, both we're on point! They had an excellent craft beer list (I work in the industry and that means something to me) my husband was only able to drink 1 beer, because we filled up on food.

I suggest the green beans and BBQ burned ends, those were my favorites. We ordered 5 items off the menu, nothing disappointed. I feel like you can't go wrong. Then there was dessert.... the bourbon brownie was amazing. Homemade ice cream was the best I've ever had!

At the end of our meal Micheal asked us how everything was? We told him how impressed we were and that we will make it a point to stop in every time we visit the city.
Super good!!!  The lamb gyro-tacos are amazing!  The service was wonderful and fun!  Nice atmosphere!

Tried to get in on a Sunday night on a prior trip to Las Vegas and were surprised that they were  closed at 9:00 pm.  The place was full, but they weren't seating anyone else.  Went in for an early dinner on our most recent trip and really liked it.  We try many new restaurants every time we travel to Vegas and Carson Kitchen is one of our favorites.  This alone is a reason to go the the Fremont neighborhood.  It's a casual gastropub.  Very cool design with open kitchen.  We shared a lot of small plates and all were delicious.  We tried four of their house cocktails and loved them all.  This will be a regular stop for us.

My FAVORITE Las Vegas restaurant. I have tried almost everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. Bacon Jam, Chicken Skins, Espresso-cocoa steak and brownie are just a few of my favorites. I love the casual, trendy atmosphere. Good drinks, too. It's fun to sit on the rooftop on a warm night.
Exciting menu and venue. Cool vibe.  Looking forward to enjoying the outside area as the weather permits.

Funky little joint with a great vibe and even better food. My wife and I ordered six different items and all were great and each dish had a special unique touch. Will be back soon. Tara was awesome and engaging. 

Tim & Tahmy
Incredible food! Great atmosphere, doesn't look like a restaurant from the outside. They have a nice outside patio. People are awesome and food is some of the best in downtown!

What a GEM of a place in Downtown Las Vegas...Went to a birthday celebration with friends this past saturday night and the atmosphere upstairs was amazing, the service incredibly attentive and fun and the food...OMG...just spectacular and fun too...loved every bite of everything we had....Our menu included their yummy bacon jam with brie cheese....to die for, crispy chicken skins with a honey -like dip ( seriously good), Rootbeer braised short rib sliders, an amazing roasted  beet salad, omg... then there were the Veal meatballs with the sherry foi gras cream ( could not get enough of these), then the swordfish, so delicate and full of flavor , the rabbit ragu served on spaghetti squash was D E L I C I O U S & THEN their baked mac and cheese that had the PERFECT amount of creaminess and then crunch on the top......oh my....I must go back for more of this soon...I mean the list goes on and on....My beverage was never empty unless I wanted it to be and then there was dessert....this Glazed Doughnut Bread pudding.....oh I think I will crave it constantly and I sure cannot forget to mention since I'm a dessert person...I had two desserts......so I had to have some of the Bourbon fudge Brownie with the Brown butter bacon Ice cream..that;s right...bacon in the ice cream...I mean who doesn't LOVE bacon?? The staff that waited on us was  Jenna &  Andrew- Bartenders
Courtney & Ariel - Servers and then Chuck the Manager ...amazing, fun and delightful staff

I really can't wait to go back ...you absolutely MUST eat at Carson Kitchen...Did I mention how cool this place is...fun, eclectic and rustic atmosphere...not like any other place in town...probably because it's in an old hotel...check it out

This place has the best food in Lv hands down. Very trendy and eclectic...you'll feel comfortable wearing jeans heels and a cute top...plan on being super friendly to the staff. They are all super cool and informative.

Definitely a respite from the seediness of downtown vegas. Felt like I was in a smaller city at a great local's spot. Bold flavors were on point. The prices are reasonable, but take into account the a la carte style menu before expecting it to be super cheap. Giancarlo took great care of me at the bar. Will definitely be back!

Always a pleasure coming into Carson's kitchen! I've been coming here since they opened last year! Amazing dishes, excellent service. Also great , and comforting. And always playing the best jams!! Rainbow cauliflower owns my heart

Nice new restaurant downtown.  Spacing is limited in the downstairs dining room.  Looking forward to dining al fresco on the upstairs patio once it cools off. 

I had the root beer sliders, meatballs, burger, devils eggs, and cucumber soda.  Loved everything.  Only gripe is the root beer sliders are too sweet and takes away from the integrity of the beef.  Portions are moderate and pricing is average to high.  

Cool urban concept that looks to add to the growing downtown dining scene.  Service is casual but attentive.  The server recognized my friend from the last visit.

Service was pretty good and what we ordered was pretty good.   Chicken patty was fresh and the beef in the burger seemed fresh not frozen.    Not a huge menu but had a urban feel.  Read a review mentioning crickets...,.just FYI.....there are crickets everywhere in Vegas.  Too many for me and I did see one in the restaurant as well.  This problem seems to be bigger than Carsons Kitchen though.

This is a cool little place in downtown but, for me, didn't live up to the hype. I had the killer shrimp and the cauliflower, which were ok, but drenched in sauce and seasoning. Like most places in Vegas, way overpriced for what you get and decent at best service.

CK is a really nice find if you are ever at Freemont Street. Why eat the bleh food at the Casinos or nearby fast food when you can get good drinks and creative food so close by. The gyros tacos were great starters and the black rice risotto-very nice. The short rib grilled cheese and chicken sandwich were both excellent. The staff are really nice. Parking at neonopolis is close by and cheap.

I don't even know where to start.

Have you ever had waitstaff notice that your burger wasn't cooked quite right from just a glance, then immediately come over and offer to redo it? Because we did. We've NEVER had such amazing service at a restaurant. 

We've also never had such amazing mac and cheese. If I wasn't half comatose from stuffing myself, I would write lengthy, borderline inappropriate poetry to honor Carson Kitchen's mac and cheese.

Bread pudding made from doughnuts. Are you freaking kidding me?

This place has officially been added to our must-visit list for future Vegas trips.

Second time dinning here and was amazing again! We had the Bacon Jam to start, it was a great treat, and I don't even like bacon! 

Then had the Black Rice Oxtail Risotto, which is out of this world and so filling. I like the upstairs outside patio, didn't feel like we were in Vegas anymore.

I think the staff forgot about us to seat us, but it was only a short while until they realized it.

I didn't find the food to be mind blowing, but it was good, flavorful, and I think I would eat here again.  I just don't think I will be a frequent diner. 

I got the fried green tomato (crab) sandwich.  It was pretty good, 3.5/5.  The crab was seasoned with an odd herb combo which I thought may have been rosemary?  It was still good, just different to my pallet.  The others in my party ordered the bacon jam, the sliders, and gyro tacos, and they even comped us a free Mac n Cheese because they brought a plate out late.  Everything was pretty enjoyable overall.  My one complaint would be the tater tots.  They are seasoned very heavily, almost overkill.  The beer menu was a little different as well, probably could be expanded upon to better match and compliment the food flavors.

Venue has a industrial loft inspiration with interesting lighting and exposed brick, and the upstairs patio was raved about.  Very downtown Vegas vibe for sure. 
The staff was great and super welcoming, friendly and willing to accommodate.

Well done! There are the expected service issues of a new place, but aside from that, I could not have been more pleased. My lunch date and I had the mac and cheese, empanadas, and gyro taco. The taco shell was much too large and could have used some more pico, but the flavor was good. Service was slow, but pleasant.  I couldn't help but notice a lot of management and/or stakeholders milling about and not helping with service/refills/ ect. All in all, I will be back.
The food was amazing  we had the gyro tacos, jerk turkey burger and the halibut. We sat at the bar and Tara, the bartender, was so sweet and helpful!

Top tier gastropub with fresh meals prepared in open kitchen. The gyro tacos were scruptious, the chicken delightful! Tasty fresh beet salad!  Gluten free food options available. Top this with the best cherry sangria, give this a five star rating.

Came to town for the weekend with a group of friends, and through a recommendation, came to Carson's Kitchen.  

The food is fantastic, as is the service!  We ordered several dishes to share and but some of my personal favorite apps were the Black Rice Risotto with Oxtail, and the Burnt Ends.  For the main course, the Red Snapper and Chicken Thighs were simply amazing.  We finished off the meal with a couple deserts, and couldn't get enough Bourbon Fudge Brownie.  

I couldn't recommend this place enough, great atmosphere, great drinks, and as mentioned, the food was absolutely delicious.

Felicia was the bomb diggity server. Jokes and impressions were abundant and funny. We sat on the rooftop which was really cozy and epic. The food was phenomenal and the staff makes the entire experience fun and light. I felt like I was in Brooklyn (Major compliment).

This is my new favorite restaurant in Vegas. I hope to god it is here next time I'm in town. Great drinks and great food. Inventive twists on standards and you can tell they actually care about what they're serving.

Was our first time eating there.  I think our server's name was Audrey(? - blonde with glasses).  She was super cool to my wife and I.  Food was great.  The chicken skins were amazing and the butter burger was awesome.  Just a cool vibe inside the place.  No doubt we will stop by next time we are there.

Wow the food is fantastic.  Some of the portions are small, but perfect if you are going to share several dishes with your wife who can't make up her mind LoL.  

The dessert was great. The bacon ice cream was " to die for" according to my wife.  The bread pudding was great as well.    The green eggs and ham was good, however a touch spicy

Walked in here at around 9pm originally just wanted some cocktails , the hostess asked of we would like a table & also offered the bar . We went for the bar because at this point we didn't know if we were guna grab anything to eat , Tara was our bartender she was hands down one of the best bartenders I have ever had the pleasure to meet , both me and my boyfriend are in the industry & we were both impressed by her hospitality . She had no problem explaining the drinks to us and giving us recommendations. We had a few cocktails , that were great we had a Flatbread the jalapeño poppers and dessert. The bourbon brownie was heaven ! Anyways to make a long story short this place rocked ! They have a great place going here , we will be back soon!  Thank you tara! & thank you Carson kitchen for the great food !
Amazing food and drinks. Andrew the bartender was fantastic. Fresh farm to table food at a great price.

Had a family member come to town so I decided to take him to Carson Kitchen.  Unfortunately, it turned out to be a mixed bag.  We ordered one of the "social plates" the chicken skins which come with honey.  It was ok but I wouldn't order it again.  Family member wanted something else to dip it in and was told no.  Ordered the Rainbow Cauliflower which is the worst dish I've had in a long time.  The flavor was so caustic, I almost couldn't breath.  Fortunately the Baked Mac and Cheese arrived and it was delicious.  Finally, I ordered the Butter Burger and tater tots which was very well cooked and was very impressive.  I was surprised how much I liked the tots.   Cooked to perfection, I highly recommend them.  ---There are so many great restaurants in town I wouldn't make a special trip to go here.  If you do, get a table, don't sit at the bar, service wasn't that great.
I have been to better and classy restaurants in Vegas. The food was good but service is baddddddd. Stick to wine or beer because cocktails are not worth $$.

First, try to find it. the address is Sixth Street by entrance isn't on Sixth Street. Do you think you could give us a clue on the side of the building? Secondly, Its small and service is oblivious. We sat with a view of the kitchen but the servers decided to grace us with their butts by bending right in front of us and leaning on the counter for the duration of our stay.

Thirdly, don't expect to get a decent meal. This is Tapas at its minimum. Finally the area isn't great. Parking is a joke and sadly homeless people are a plenty seen going thru garbage and trying to survive. Bottom line... with so many famous chefs overcharging and producing small plates all over the strip why bother with this one all the way downtown with so little to offer?
This was a find for us thanks to Yelp. Great neighborhood find....food was delish! Catfish sandwich and Flatbread....tempura green beans and gyro tacos....really great!

Carson Kitchen is a rare combination of a warm, inviting atmosphere, a welcoming staff and food with flavors that will blow your socks off. I couldn't recommend it more strongly. The Mac n cheese rivals the time tested recipe of my southern roots and he turkey burger snuck up on me like a ninja and smacked me across the face with its sweet and savory one-two punch. Do yourself a favor and high tail it to Carson Kitchen. I might just be sitting there when you arrive.

This is one of the BESTEST (yes I said BESTEST) restaurant's in the downtown area.  Customer service is always on point (if you sit at the bar) the food is always delicious and the drinks are excellent (the only gripe is they do not have chilled beer glasses and the Moscow Mules are served in a regular Collins glass)

I recommend going some place else!! There are so many other places to eat that also have decent customer service. (Le Thai just around the corner has great food and amazing service!!) After waiting outside for the restaurant to open, which you could clearly see people (staff) inside by the door and which I had tried to open earlier, no one came to ask if I was waiting or to even acknowledge restaurant was open. I was first in restaurant (with no line at all). The hostess asked if I wanted to sit at the bar and with no other patrons in there I asked to sit at a table. The manager (man) said they do not seat party's of one. First, no one is at the restaurant and second,  I have seen in past reviews people said sometime multiple parties would have to be seated at a table. I guess I should have known the experience was not going well when there was no line unlike other places close to this one.  The manager did say as I was walking out the door if I was going to leave they could seat me at a table...no thank you I prefer my food with at least decent customer service!!! I will let my local Vegas friends as well as people visiting to go to another place!
Update: I was contacted by Cory who was very gracious and apologetic. I want to thank him for his quick response. Next time when I am in Vegas I will give the restaurant another try, but sometimes you have only one chance to make a good first impression.

Really like this place.  The plates are small and delicious and good for sharing.  We basically ordered half the menu and nothing disappointed!  The chicken sandwich was and especially good standout along with the fried green beans.  Friendly service.  Restaurant was kind of small without the upstairs open but still good and hipster like.  Great drink selection! Definitely gonna go back to see how the menu changes seasonally.

This place has such a great vibe and  decorated beautifully. There's communal style dining and separate tables with and open kitchen. I love the touch of a "Swear Jar" on the kitchen counter. I've also heard that the rooftop patio is open but didn't go up there because it was 100 degrees outside. 

Tara was our server and she was attentive and funny. She even made the cocktails we ordered behind the bar, talk about a girl that can multitask! 

Crispy Chicken skins - this dish is amazing for people that love fried food. It's not greasy or oily and is seasoned perfectly. It comes with a side of honey to dip it in. 
Perfect mix of salty and sweet. 

Black rice and Oxtail risotto - my favorite risotto I've eaten. The first bite made my jaw drop because I enjoyed it so much, especially the parmesan cream it was in. I can't explain all the flavors in it but it's a dish I would get every visit here. 

Veal Meatballs - sherry Foie Gras cream and peas. The sauce was very light and added the perfect touch to the meatballs. 

Chicken thighs - the citrus chimichurri sauce made so savory with the juicy chicken. 

As for cocktails, we tried Drink With The Ms. (pig's nose whiskey, amaro del sole, grapefruit juice, fresh lime, maple syrup, crabbie's ginger beer) and The Margarian (aviation gin, thyme & honey syrup, fresh lemon, mr. q cumber soda). Both were extremely refreshing on a scorching summer day in Vegas. 

I'm already looking at the menu to decide what to eat in my next visit. Can't wait! And yes, this place is that good!!!

FYI: the restaurant is located in the newly refurbished John E. Carson Hotel. We had a tough time finding it at first because we entered through the Bikram Yoga door. It fastest to just walk around the building on the outside and stay on Carson.

Loved this new gem! Absolutely a great find for fine dining in Vegas DT area:)
Really friendly staff, prompt service and that big smile win me over at first minute!
Pig in a duvet was my favorite. Love that cute name!
Steak was good, can't remember the full name anymore but it was just on point!
Will def go back again.
Oh! And their check, in a BOOK, was awesome! Don't want to spoil it, go check it out yourself!

Reposting with more information...

A few friends and I visited for dinner based on Yelp reviews, we were put on the waitlist and headed to the patio to wait. As we headed towards the unlocked, unblocked, door with no "closed" sign or indication, the manager began yelling at us across the restaurant. His tone along with a waving finger were embarassing and offensive in a restaurant full of people. The hostess then calmly explained the patio was closed for cleaning. Not an apology or even another glance from the rude manager until we sat down to eat. 

The food was decent, our group shared  several of the appetizers, entrees, and desserts. The waitress, Nicole, was very nice and attentive. I was given dirty silverware and requested a clean spoon, which they brought as well as comping our dessert. 

Overall, a 4/5 for food quality, but I stick to my rating of 1/5 as an overall experience based on the incident that instilled my first impression.

Carson kitchen is one of our favorite spots in DTLV. I have been a fan of Kerry Simon since he opened Simons at Hard Rock Hotel. 
He truly puts a new spin on classic comfort food. I mean, Fried Chicken Skin?!?! So delicious. 
My husband is a big fan of the burger. I had the veggie flatbread. And both were fresh and tasty. 
Service is amazing. We sat at the bar to eat. I don't know his name but he is a true mixologist. Every drink is hand crafted to perfection. 
The only bad thing is that is is small. And when it gets busy it feels kind of cramped. We didn't have to wait but I imagine the wait time on a busy night could be long. 
Love DTLV and love Carson Kitchen!

In town for the weekend and saw the good reviews so my family and I stopped by. Amazing food and great service. We had the BBQ burnt tips, baked mac and cheese, and the short rib grilled cheese. I highly recommend getting these three items. Also, the donut bread pudding was great!

This is the spot in old town, about as real as it gets away from the strip ie real people, real food. The vouvrey fine is a fantastic selection when it comes to white wine; the Barbera was  tough as a red. The meats were done just right, so was the seafood - the beets were great too! Overall, a great spot !

I was in Vegas for the first time. I couldn't WAIT to get off the strip. I found this little gem by chance and decided to give it a try. We couldn't make a reservation but called on the way over to put our names on. We ordered drinks at the bar, and suddenly our table was ready. I loved my "Get Shorty" -- sort of a spicy margarita. We sat outside on the patio upstairs. It was warm, welcoming and wonderful. 

All of our food was delicious. Most memorable were the bacon jam (what?) and the veal meatballs. I'm Swedish, and I know a thing or two about meatballs. It was something in between Swedish meatballs and another Swedish dish called Wallenbergare. Pure delight. 

I loved the cool atmosphere, and such a diverse crowd.

Thanks so much. If I get to Vegas again I will be back!

Loved the vibrant atmosphere, decor and staff! The food was absolutely delicious.  Dined on fried chicken skins, bacon jam with Brie, cucumber watermelon salad, rainbow cauliflower, bison sliders, and thai pizza. Every item was fresh, lovely to the eyes and better on my palate
Delicious!  This place was recommended by a local chef and didn't disappoint, loved the short rib grilled cheese and grilled artichoke!  Wish this place was in San Diego.

Wow!  Super place and great prices.  It made the trip downtown worth it.  So many interesting choices.  Loved the deviled eggs.  The bacon jam is to die for.  Will definitely be back next time I am in Vegas.

A gem! Unexpected and impressive.  Sat at 'bar' and watched artful food prep --- truly a treat of a restaurant. Highly recommended.  Great & friendly service. We waited a bit for fish sandwich and were brought a free appetizer. We will be back! (Desserts were amazing!!)
Omg... Mac and cheese, mushroom flatbread... mushroom everything. Literally everything was perfect or beyond expectations. Cannot recommend this place enough.

Probably my favorite spot in town. Funky downtown vibe, great food, great service. Public parking is across the street. It can get kinda busy in there so call ahead if you have a large party. It's tapas/family sharing style and the portions aren't very big so be prepared to order quite a bit. Can be pricey but well worth he money. Don't l ave without trying the chicken skins.
This place was SOOO good!! It is small, but that is part of its charm...also not cheap, but worthy of a date night or outing with the girls!

First off our server Bianca was amazing. We were a party of 8 and none of us had ever been here so we decided to try a few menu items and drinks of course. We ordered the chicken skins, Baked Mac and cheese, bacon jam, tempura green beans, Butter burger, jerk turkey burger, short rib grilled cheese, Green eggs and ham, Bourbon Fudge Brownie and Glazed donut bread pudding. My favorite were the short rib grilled cheese, Mac and cheese and bourbon fudge brownie. The other favorites at the table were the green eggs and ham and bacon jam. This is not to say the other items were not good by any means. I would definitely recommend Carson Kitchen to anyone if you want to try food with so many different flavors. Oh and their drinks were amazing as well.

I enjoy sitting at the counter, watching the food being prepared.  Be sure to try their deep-fried chicken skins.  Amazing.  I enjoy their butter burgers-- excellent burgers smothered with melted butter while on the grill.  Place is very popular and busy, so expect some wait time.  HIghly recommended.

Used to spend about $1500.00 a month here when it first opened but like all businesses downtown they tried something new, and changed the menu. They quality is steadily declining. Seems that people who are friends of employees get their food faster, the person who got special treatment and I know each other. The shrimp dish they added to the menu tastes like crap. Last time I'll be here. Bye Felicia
Carson Kitchen is AMAZING!!!!  Cool new spot downtown, great outdoor seating, awesome staff and the food is soooo good!!!!!  New fave!!!

This place was great! Given all the wonderful reviews, we were really expecting it to be awesome! It didn't disappoint, for the most part. 

The inside is small but fun, and has a good atmosphere. It's loud and lively. Seems like a fun downtown place. Had I known about the patio when I made the reservations, we would have definitely been up there! So fun!

The waiter was great - friendly and attentive, but not too much. 

For food, plates are smaller- like tapas style, and they make for a great date/small party. They "suggest" that you share, but it's basically forced sharing as everyone's food comes out at different times. We had a large group and the first persons dish to the last was nearly 25 minutes. Sharing ended up being fine but if you're not a sharer or are with people you don't really want digging into your food, maybe go elsewhere that night. It's a little pricey for the small portions, but that's the "in" thing.

We ordered:
Pork Osso Buco - Definitely tender... fall of the bone but it was lacking flavor. I'd skip it. 
Black Rice & Oxtail Risotto - My husband ordered this and ate every last bite, so I'd say it was good. 
Chicken Skins - These are spicy! Spicy enough I couldn't eat them. The sauce is interesting too. Good if you like liquid smoke. 
Mac and Cheese - Was good!
Gyro Tacos - I'd probably order only this if we ever go back. 

The drinks were great - I got sangria and it was like juice. I think I knocked back 3 before I told the waiter no more!

It's kid friendly, but be aware that they don't have high chairs.

Definitely fun for drinks/apps. Treat it like that instead of a restaurant. and Sit outside!

Wonderful!  Eclectic American cuisine with a lot of really interesting choices on the menu.  Everything fresh and very high quality.  Everything we ordered was delicious.  I will visit any time I am anywhere nearby!  It's worth a special trip!

Went there on a Saturday night with two girlfriends. Temps were in the high 50's, low 60's. They had heat lamps and even brought us snuggies to keep us warm! The service was impeccable. The food- amazing!!! Far exceeded my expectations. We started with the gyro tacos- so tasty, so delicious. Then we had the tomato stack, broccoli crunch, chicken thighs, short rib sliders, and the turkey burger. ALL EXCELLENT. Not one mediocre item. We shared the bread pudding for desert.. Again- delectable. I cannot wait to go back- and bring my family and friends who haven't been.. Downtown Vegas just keeps getting better- and Carson Kitchen is the perfect addition! A gem.

Cool urban vibe.  Reminded me of the East Coast a little.  The food will not blow your mind and is not of the same quality that you would find in the michelin starred strip restaurants, but it is tasty enough to be a great value.  I definitely recommend checking it out with a group and sitting upstairs on the patio.  Service was excellent as well.

This is the first time I've ever reviewed anything,  but I've been here twice now and believe this to be the best spot to be period in Nevada. Everything was perfect from the atmosphere to The Taste and timing of every entree.

The food was good. The chicken skins were crazy overpriced for literal trash food. The bartender was kind of a tool.
The prices are pretty high and everyone seems like they're trying a bit too hard for what they serve. 
I will say it was one of the best turkey burgers I've ever had.

Excellent meal and atmosphere in Downtown Las Vegas.  Two visits to this restaurant and it was great each time.  The chicken skins, beets, tempura green beans, bacon jam, and veal meatballs are all highly recommended.  Each item was very unique and satisfying.  In fact, I have not tried anything that I would not order again.  Lots of small plate options will enable you to try a little of everything.  The wait staff is very friendly and seem to enjoy their work.  The restaurant atmosphere is very unique and has a hip vibe.  It is slightly off the beaten path, but still well worth the trip.
Very chill vibe and the food was great. Tons of flavors, plated beautifully, and definitely not your typical tapas bar.
The cocktails were amazing and all the food was delicious. We had 5 of us and it was a bit of a wait - this is a super small place - but the wait was worth it.

Carson Kitchen graciously donated a gift certificate as a silent auction item for a local non-profit, Safe Nest, that provides shelter and services to survivors of domestic abuse. I am so grateful for their generosity. And as for the food, this place is amazing! I went there with 3 girlfriends and we enjoyed ourselves so much. We started with the tempura green beans and the bacon jam. Both were divine. For our entrees, 2 had the NY strip which was cooked perfectly, 1 had the turkey burger, and another had the seared scallops. We also shared the baked mac and cheese, which was sinfully delicious. Then we indulged in sharing the glazed donut bread pudding, which was out of this world! And the service was swift and courteous. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed the meal and the overall experience! Can't wait to bring my husband here soon!

I cannot say enough about Carson Kitchen.  The food is awesome, the services is amazing, and what a fun environment!  We sat on stools facing the cooks, so we were able to watch all the prep.  The thing I was struck by the most was how well the staff gets along.  They seemed happy to be doing their jobs and the affection they had for one another was clearly evident.  The food is phenomenal.  We ordered the Chicken skins, asparagus salad, butter burger and pizza (ham and pineapple).  Everything was delicious.  The chicken skins are very popular, and although I like crispy skin, they were a bit much for me.  The idea of eating all that skin kind of got in my head a little,  but my husband loved them.  We had the bourbon brownie and bacon ice cream for dessert.  It was so rich and delicious.  I highly recommend Carson Kitchen.  We will make this a must stop during all our trips to Vegas!  (p.s. this restaurant is in the old part near Fremont Street.  It is wedged in the middle of an old building - facing the street.  There is on street parking, but be ready to put some money in the kiosk.  Nothing is free in Vegas anymore!)

I ordered the chicken skins, succotash, cauliflower, and beet/goat cheese salad. The star were the chicken skins. The succotash veggies were too undercooked for my taste. The cauliflower was seasoned perfectly and the fresh lemon accompanied the brightness of the cauliflower.  This cafe is on my list for my future Vegas trips.

Gyro taco, Mac and cheese, chicken skins and flat breads were on point! The food was amazing and service was great! Only problem was that the kitchen was outrageously long for food to come out, however Bianca our server was great and handled everything above and beyond! If you head out to Carson Kitchen, get Bianca she makes the experience!
The service was great. Food was ok. Like the ambiance. Would return, they said they change the menu every 3 months. Open kitchen, very clean. I respect that.

In a city where most chefs seem to want to oversalt everything, it is nice to finally have a well spiced meal. Everything was flavourful and well cooked. Siting ans watch them cook in the kitchen was a treat. The KD (okay, mac and cheese) was so tasty. And the boneless chicken thighs were great too.

If we had to find fault it was the air conditioning that blew and cooled our food. And if that's the best I can do for a fault... you know this is a great place to eat.

Nestled close to container park this epicurean virtuoso seems to seamlessly blend in with the revitalized vibe of the area.  The atmosphere is fast-paced the surroundings are a mix of rustic and modern and the food is fantastic.  You definitely need to come early if you're going to get a good seat as there are limited places to sit. But anyway wait you could experience is certainly worth it when you bite into one of their unforgettable entrées.

I truly adore Carson Kitchen, but the last time we visited, was completely awful. I know plenty of restaurant managers on and off the strip but never have I been so offended by the manager that worked that evening.

It was slow evening when we arrived and were offered a table for 3 but our 3rd flaked out. Either way we're we're served well, except for the fact my lady noticed the manager continuously stare at us from afar. He finally came up to us and asked if our guest was going to arrive. As soon as we said no, he grabbed the napkins and place settings with such a bad attitude and walked away without a word. 

We had our meals but we're still annoyed and Mike kept leering at us. Finally, we got our check and we're about to pay when he, grabbed the check out of our servers hands. He came back and stated, "I took care of the appetizer, thanks for understanding and we needed you to get up quickly!" 


Wtf? Like really? You could of kindly asked us to sit at the bar or another small table, and we would have been good but the way the manager Mike, handled himself was completely unprofessional, offensive, and rude as fuck. 

I will return, as long as he's not managing others with a bad attitude, giving patron rude leers and pushing them out the door.
Got here at 4:30 PM and half of the tables were open. We were refused service. Rude waitress. Terrible experience.

Yelp and numerous people led me astray on this one. 

I have the upmost respect for Kerry Simon. He has created some beautiful and well-respected restaurants. I was expecting some really fantastic food, and this was, unfortunately, not it. 

We sat at the bar, and the bartender was friendly, but service was incredibly slow. Our food took an extraordinary amount of time. We ordered the oxtail risotto and the burger. The burger was very poorly cooked and had to be sent back. Apparently, their method for cooking does not align with how we feel meat should be cooked. The oxtail risotto had a strange flavor to it that I would not like to really eat again. 

Overall, I wanted to like it, but I just couldn't.
Here for an early lunch, the food is pretty standard fare. Drinks are good, service good, no major complaints.

Great atmosphere and prices. Not a lot of gluten free options. The beet salad was one of the best I've had. I was less impressed with the burger. It had a good flavor, but it was slightly over cooked and the cheese was placed on after and not melted. I would come back and I would recommend it!

Located about a block off LVBD across from the post office. It doesn't stand out but it's worth going in. Ordered food to go: killer shrimp, Mac & cheese, & butter burger with tots. While waiting for the order we had 1 Miller Lite & 1 vodka soda. Food came to $36 dollars & was worth every penny. However our total bill was $55 so I'm guessing our drinks were pretty expensive. Staff was friendly & order was fast & correct. Wish the drinks were a little cheaper but I would eat there again.

This place is fabulous! My boyfriend and I found out about this place through a friend and decided to try it. We got the deviled eggs which I thought was strange at first to have as an appetizer, but they were excellent. We also got the bacon jam (which is heavenly), the turkey jerk burger and the regular burger. Everything was so tasty, and I could really tell that it was quality made food. I will definitely come back for some more of Carson kitchen's unique creations.

Surprisingly good, probably the best meal I had in Las Vegas!

I was expecting a "greasy spoon" based on the name, the building, and the location two blocks from Fremont Street.  But it turned out to be a classy tapas-style place, with great drinks and great food, and very friendly staff.

We had the shrimp, a plate of flatbread, mushrooms, some salad, several other shared plates.  Not a lot of food on each, but everything tasted fantastic.
Unreal food to share with the group. Highly recommend to get away from the strip for amazing food.

Just meh, nothing we ordered left us wanting more.  Felt the food was more style than substance.  At some point you have to ask yourself: is there anything I ate that I would crave some random Wednesday night?  And we didn't feel that about anything we had.  For the record we ordered: crispy chicken skin, deviled egg with caviar and pancetta, grilled artichoke, beet salad, and oxtail risotto. 
 
I try not to judge on service or ambiance too much, in the end if the food is amazing you'll go back.  But  I'm not a fan on shared seating (one long table with other people crowded around you); prefer some privacy for conversations and I hate the feeling of eavesdropping on the person sitting 1ft away from you.

Vegas restaurants can be hit or miss. My girlfriend and I stumbled on this little gem while visiting. It was so wonderful we ate there two nights in a row. 
Go early or late to avoid the rush. But it's worth the wait. Can't wait to go back.

Went there a couple of days ago.
The food was great! The fried greens and the cauliflower are highly recommended. The staff was super friendly and the place is very pleasant and clean.

Very recommended!

A truly unique dining experience. Both the drink menu and food menu items are extremely well thought out and creative. Whenever we go we end up spending hours there without realizing it. The food is delivered as it is ready and it is the type of place where you share plates. Every server we have had has been very warm and accommodating. I recommend the bacon jam, the green beans, the beef sliders and the mac n cheese. You can expect a wait to be seated, but the place has two bars and there are several others on the block.
We ordered the chicken skins, fried green tomatoes sliders,  veal meat balls.. All were delicious. It was easy to get a seat in the cozy restaurant.

Let me start off by saying that the appetizers are Amazing! We had the killer shrimp and the crispy chicken. Definitely a must try! Had the secret special chicken for my meal. It was cooked to perfection in buttery deliciousness. Sharing is definitely a good strategy when visiting. I would definitely visit again. Great service and great food.

If you like bad service, pretensiousness, and overly friendly slaps on the shoulder, then this is the place for you. Try their supremely burned "bacon jam" or the overpriced cocktails that you get hassled for sending back because the bartender learned how to make drinks at margaritaville. I returned a drink because i asked for it to be "not so sweet" but this thing was drowning in sweet n sour mix. Returned it, then waited 30 minutes for THE EXACT SAME DRINK to be poured in a different glass and they thought i wouldnt notice. Yeah i noticed, but im done making a damn scene over a bad cocktail. Screw this place. Jerkoff staff, rude hostesess (made snyde remarks to both myself and my father in law), and supremely overpriced for what you get. 

The only reason they arent getting a 1 star is because their steak and shrimp were okay.

Dont pay to "inconvenience" these people. They are too busy for you...

I just dined at Carson Kitchen last night for the first time with a few friends. It was absolutely delightful!!! I am a personal chef and I love dining out and getting new ideas to add to my menu's which I offer up to my clients. My favorite item we ordered was the bacon jam with brie. OMG. Cory, one of the owners was kind enough to share the recipe with our group. I am going to attempt to make this at my holiday party. HOLY COW. It was fantastic. I also loved the deviled eggs (the pancetta and the caviar were a wonderful touch), the veal meatballs with  cream sauce, and the chicken skins with a yummy honey dip. We had several other wonderufl dishes but these particular ones stood out. My martini was made to perfection. The atmosphere of this place reminded me of places where I used to hang out in Seattle. VERY cool vibe, and VERY busy. We had great service and overall had a really nice evening.  I can't wait to go back and bring my friends. Thank you Cory for a memorable evening at Carson Kitchen!

Went in with 4 lifetime friends getting g together  after a 30 year absence.  Being a former owner of restaurants, I automatically  critique  everything .From the second I opened the front door, I was impressed with everything  we experienced. I have eaten  in over a 1000 restaurants over the last 35 years..Carson kitchen was an exceptional experience. The decor/setup was fantastic.The service was exceptional.The food was over the top great. But the ENERGY /VIBE of  the restaurant  was PERFECT !!#1 in Vegas.That was on a Wednesday. night at 6pm. Taking wife and others there this weekend.

I had a watermelon feta salad and the mushroom flatbread pizza. Both were very unusual and delicious. They were so good that I wished I was there with another person so I could try more things. The waitstaff was very friendly. I will definitely be going back.

The best down town food i had. Service was prompt. Although selections are not that many but food were so good and delicious.

I ordered gyro tacos and crispy chicken skin.. i loved them. Serving is alot and i was stuffed..

Will definitely come back

Really liked our visit. Went with a party of six and were seated within 20 minutes of arriving (after calling ahead) on a Friday night. Great food. Some dishes were very rich but delicious all around. Our table ordered:
Chicken skins
Bacon jam 
Mac & cheese
Burger
Crab fondue 
Scallops
Shrimp
Stroganoff
Risotto 
Thai chicken flatbread 
Gyro tacos 

My favorites were the gyro tacos & mac& cheese 

Would recommend and will return!

Really enjoyed my first time here we tried a bunch of different foods my favorite being burnt ends and bacon jam they are both a must. I also ordered chicken skin and I wasn't sold on them it just wasn't that great. I enjoyed the magarian drink definitely an acquired taste but good. I highly recommend and I even got to draw a dick in a book, if you come you will understand why!

Delicious food. Fast service!

A friend and I went on a Saturday night around 5. I was surprised that there was no wait - but it was Halloween, so who knows? 

We told the server that we were in a bit of a hurry, as he had to be back at work at 7. I was amazed by how quickly our food came out - and it was all delicious. 

There was nothing particularly novel on the menu, but it was all reasonably priced and well done. 

I will definitely be back.
So good they have a "Swear Jar" because when you get your food you will SY holly sh** that's good!

Contemporary Hipster place, I was nicely surprised of the look of this place located in a neighborhood not that far from the downtown Casinos. The interior was decorated modestly, with items that really make you feel like you're in a Chef's man cave. Really dug the Chopping block tables that we ate on.

We ordered so items to share among the 4 of us, 
Wild Mushroom Flatbread, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/carson-kitchen-las-vegas?select=6s6KtuKhm2VZ5i1nVCBibQ#H-UiCPoeuxPRI7kn3enPiQ
Tempura Green beans, 
Strawberry Salad, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/carson-kitchen-las-vegas?select=6s6KtuKhm2VZ5i1nVCBibQ#slqKM9_MIbnLLE3VSYujoQ
Short Rib Stroganoff, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/carson-kitchen-las-vegas?select=6s6KtuKhm2VZ5i1nVCBibQ#ccXYYTr6ttluRq4HtUhSyw
Butter Burger, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/carson-kitchen-las-vegas?select=6s6KtuKhm2VZ5i1nVCBibQ#lkjyJ7CExGK_3qpZJM7bLg

Everything was delicious, especially the addicting Tempura Green Beans and the Butter Burger. You know that I just had to drink a Voodoo stout to complement the wonderful dishes, I highly recommend sharing dishes and tasting as much as possible. 

Love their menu and atmosphere,nice kick back feeling.The service was friendly,really good to see a staff that enjoys their job.

Probably the best meal we had while in town. Just fantastic - from the service to the atmosphere to the food. The menu is geared toward sharing which makes it good for groups, or my wife and me. We started with the mushroom flatbread. Incredible. Cannot say enough good things about it. The pickled red onions really made the dish. Next, we shared the short rib grilled cheese. Meat was tender and flavorful. Cheese mixed well with the crusty sourdough bread. Side of spicy tots worked too. For dessert, we got the glazed donut bread pudding. Yes, you read that correctly. Glazed. Donut. Bread. Pudding. It was excellent. The place is a bit hard to find with only one sign on the window. Service was great, Manny took good care of us and our check came in an old book to sign which was neat. Will definitely make it back!

The gyro tacos were out of this world, phenomenally great. The veal meatballs were delish in a modestly spicy sauce. The chicken sandwich was excellent as well. Service was fast and excellent, thank you Manny. This is 5 star at its best.

From the minute we got here it was great. The atmosphere on the back patio while your waiting for a table is relaxing. We were seated at the bar and had great service and a wonderful experience with the bartender Geronimo!! The wait is worth it all of the food we had was amazing. The flavors in the crispy chicken, the caviar eggs and the brownie sundae for dessert. You must try this place if your in town or visit one of their other locations in Henderson, punta Cana or Palm Springs.

One of our favorite restaurants!! Everything that comes out of the kitchen has been absolutely incredible. Our favorites: oxtail rissotto, veal meatballs, mac & cheese. I made a reservation for my boyfriends 30th birthday as a surprise to him with his friends- and they gave us a great table. We tried lots of food and everything was on point, as always. The chocolate brownie desert was also INCREDIBLE. Service was on point and stayed on top of our drinks. Thanks for another great night!

Loved it here. This restaurant was amazing. The staff was super nice and cool. I loved the open kitchen. We sat at the bar seating by the kitchen so were able to see everything. It's mesmerizing. They have great drinks. I loved the octopus and the cauliflower dishes. I hope to get here when I am in Vegas next.

Yum dot com, people! I really appreciate places that put unique spins on things or do classics really, really well. We had mac and cheese, strip steak, cauliflower, Greek tacos -- all were tasty! 

Our waitress was VERY attentive in the way that she always kept our waters and wine glasses full (not over the top, though). I will say, they have maximized the crap out of that space. I didn't go upstairs, but in the downstairs dining area, you may be sitting next to strangers. It's cozy, not weird, I promise! 

I honestly don't know what more to say other than, the service was great, the place was clean and the most important part (food, duh) was delicious with items that you may not be able to find as easily in other places. Just look at the photos and see for yourself!

Bottom line: Excellent gastropub fare and great service!

We walked in for lunch and had:

1) Bacon jam (Such a simple but decadent dish. I mean, how can anything with spreadable bacon and melted brie be bad?)
2) Killer shrimp (hot, crispy juicy deep fried shrimp...again, how could you go wrong?)
3) Oxtail and black rice risotto (unbelievably rich and amazing. The raw garlic in the gremolata they top it with takes it over the top in the best possible way)
4) Sunday fried chicken sandwich (pretty great as far as fried chicken breast sandwiches go... The spicy tots they serve on the side are the real star)
5) Rainbow cauliflower. (GET IT. Especially since the main entrees don't come with sides)
6) Chicken thighs (Well-cooked, but literally it's just two chicken thighs on a plate with some chimichurri. Also WAY oversalted.)
7) Short rib stroganoff (This was the only misfire of our meal. Whatever spirit they used in the sauce completely overpowered the dish and gave it a horrible aftertaste. The meat was perfectly done though)

Service was awesome! Tiny space, so make reservations. We came in during the lunch hour and got a table, but it was packed by the time we left.

Disappointed from the minute we walked in. Space was available at both bars and there were three empty tables inside. We were told there was a 30 minute wait and we could go to the bar upstairs. Went upstairs, sat at a table and we were told we could not sit there because the tables were "for reservations." The tables had seating for four, not six. Why they were for reservations were did not undersstand because the hostest said, "reservations were for parties of 6 or more." The whole expierence was confusing, made no sense and we left. On our way out we asked about all the empty tables and the hostest said, "they were for reservations."

Such a hip, trendy gem right off Las Vegas blvd in the (somewhat seedy) Fremont st area. We sat right at the counter and got to watch the kitchen team cook and create each delicious meal! Our faves were definitely the burnt ends, sunday chicken sandwich, mac and cheese, and black mussels -- all yum! Drinks were also very, very good and the female blond bartender at the roof bar upstairs was very friendly and down to earth. Also loved the firepit and outside "chill area." Worth the uber ride if you're out of town like us and staying on strip!

Las Vegas is a great food town, but we had to get away from the strip for the best meal of our trip. We found Carson Kitchen on yelp and the reviews are right on. Carson Kitchen is a cozy, eclectic restaurant. My husband and I sat at the counter by the kitchen. It was fun watching all the activity. I'm big on atmosphere and this place scores five stars. Don't expect large portions. I ordered scallops, which were excellent, but the order only comes with three scallops for $17. Worth it, at least for me. I also had the strawberry salad. Very fresh like the scallops. Greens with strawberries, candied pecans, thinly sliced Parmesan cheese, and a strawberry vinaigrette. I asked for the dressing on the side because I wasn't sure I would like it, but it was good. Thick but tasty. My husband had the chicken thighs with spicy tater tots. He let me eat one tarot tot and it was delisch. He thought the chicken was ok. I had a little bit of his and thought it was juicy and good, but not spectacular. Then we had dessert - the banoffie pie. It was excellent. Graham cracker crust with Bailey's cream and bananas and a piece of chocolate biscotti. This is definitely a place for foodies. Oh, and I had two glasses is the Velvet Devil Merlot, which is one of my faves.

This place is small but probably the perfect size.  I got there a little early for dinner so there was no wait, but by the time we left it was packed.
The drink menu is well rounded and enjoyed a lot of the beers and cocktails. 
All of the food was awesome. We ordered almost every single one of the dishes under the social plates and the were all delicious in there own way. The only one that I didn't think was out of this world but still delicious was the shrimp which was just fried sauced rock shrimp.
Our server was nice and on point.
All in all well worth the small price point for the quality of food recieved

Still the best burger I've ever had. Blows every celebrity chef burger in Vegas out of the water (yes you Ramsay, Guy etc.) when a turkey burger is juicer than any beef burger I've ever had.. nuff said.

Delicious, unexpected, exactly what this California couple was hoping to find. Awesome charred octopus with a lovely sauce, then some deviled eggs, yum.... cauliflower with unexpected but delicious lemon.... asparagus with pickles and capers a delight. Then a shared burger and great Malbec rounded out our best meal in 5 days in Vegas. Thanks!
Nice food and service...The waitress was very nice - even funny...Will eat there again soon...

A crowded eatery means  the food is good,  and at Carson kitchen it really is.  Space is really utilized in this small place,  so you might have to wait a little to get a table or bar seat.

The stacked tomato is a caprese salad dressed to impress,  the flavors are clean and crisp.   Chicken skins are not really my style,  but if you're craving something crispy and salty these are perfect. The jerk turkey burger is perfectly seasoned,  and big.

Food was delicious was service was awesome. We had the chicken skins, bacon jelly, and jerk turkey burger. Everything tastes delicious and would order it again. Our server Felicia was attentive and friendly, the food came out in good timing, and the kitchen was spotless. I will be returning to try more things.

Dining at Carson's was unique for two reasons: one, dishes were featured in small platters so that we could get a taste of each without it ever growing old on us; two, our family got to share dishes, rather than eating a plate each, making it a delightful "family night" experience. Although a bit on the pricey side, it was well worth the 30 minute walk.

Wow. This place is UH-mazing.  Located right by Old Town Vegas, it's definitely a hidden gem. The place is on a discrete location that really keep the "tourists" away and definitely has a more local vibe. 

The ambience is a bit of a gastropub feel. High and low tables pack the cozy joint plus a full bar and stool that overlook that kitchen give it a very intimate atmosphere.  They also have a back patio where people can lounge and mingle while they wait for their table. 

Did I mention that this place was created by the late Kerry Simon? This was also a major + as I have heard he was an amazing chef with unexpected creations. 

We ordered several taps-style dishes that were all perfection. Note most food is made to share and come out as they are ready. 

Crispy Chicken skins with smoke honey - definitely a must-try of fried goodness. Honey is a nice touch and complement to the skins. 
Fried tempura with pepper jelly cream cheese - similar to the skins quite delicious.
(note: I probably would only choose one or the other next time, it was a little too similar from a fried, finger-food standpoint) 
New to the menu. SPAM sliders with seaweed salad, grilled pineapple and "yummy" sauce plus spicy tater tots - Probably my favorite dish. 
Black Rice Oxtail Risotto with Parmesan Cheese - Oh so rich and you could just taste the flavor of the Risotto. 
"Devil's" Eggs, crispy pancetta and caviar - Omg. you had me had deviled eggs. I think I could have eaten 3 orders of it easily. 

We were sad to hear that we missed the pork belly but I am sure that dish would have been great. 

They don't take reservations but it doesn't matter. You must try this place!!!!

This place is so good.  It wasn't what I was expecting, but I'm glad we stayed.  It's a pretty small place and it's a lot of open/social seating so don't be surprised when they sit you next to other people.  Also, it's more of a small plates type place.  I recommend planning to share and spending a decent amount of cash.  I had glanced at the menu so I was expecting $15-20 a person, but realistically $30-50 a person will be a more enjoyable experience.

Everything we ordered was great.  I devoured the veal meatballs.. sooo much flavor.  I wish it would've came with more.  The secret sunday chicken sandwich was very tasty and I recommend that as well.  And you must finish with the glazed donut bread pudding.  It was so delicious!  We also ordered some german potato salad, cauliflower, and a pork chop as well.  Those were all great, but not as highly recommended as the options I mentioned previously.

Get here early if you can. I would imagine this place would be pretty hard to come to with a large group.  This place should be on your must-try list.

This was my first time in Vegas and I wanted the whole experience so I researched places off the Strip and Carson's Kitchen came highly recommended - and definitely did not disappoint. 

The dining space isn't really big but is comfortable. My date and I were able to dine at the bar and watch the chefs cook in their open kitchen. The food was served in small plate portion sizes which I liked so I could sample more things. The gyro tacos and mac and cheese were SO good. The staff was super nice and attentive. Pricing is definitely reasonable for the quality of food. 

I can't wait to go back for more.

The food here is great. I've been here numerous times and the wait staff is also excellent. 

Must haves: fried green beans with pepper jelly 
  Bacon jam
  Ox tail risotto

My 20th time here. My favorite downtown. 

Watermelon salad and jerk turkey burger are my go to's but there's so many great items on the menu. 

Beer menu is far above average for a downtown lunch spot.
