Carson is ALWAYS consistent in all the food, no matter when you go. Definitely is a great legacy for Chef Kerry Simon and highly deserving of 5 stars on Yelp (if anyone still takes Yelp seriously)
Great place downtown, it's Tapas style type restaurant and everything I had here was delicious.
This is my favorite restaurant downtown. We cone there quite a bit for birthdays and lunches. The butter burger and bacon jam are my go tops and the green beans are pretty amazing as well

My wife and I shared a truly wonderful meal!  From the Brie w/ bacon jam to the Veal meatballs, every plate was exceptional in taste and execution. The service was fast and friendly and we were lucky to be seated at the counter were we could watch the chefs work their magic. Chef John was also super cool and fun to talk to.  Carson Kitchen is also a terrific value, we had 4 plates and a bottle of Malbec all for under $100- we will definitely be back!

Mind blowing. Bacon jam with truffle Mac and cheese was beyond amazing. They actually go well together when you mix the two, as per the server's recommendation. Alligator flatbread, however, is an acquired taste - a little divisive among us who dined in.
My first visit! Loved up to its reputation. Place was packed. Well earned NY Times praise in the Wednesday food section

I checked this place out on a Sunday afternoon before heading back to Cali last weekend with a couple of heads. I saw previous reviews and pics on this place and wanted to give it a try. I would recommend coming here if you're with a group of friends and are ready to have some food and drinks and shoot the shit.  

So, we ordered the chicken skins, deviled eggs, and bacon jam to start off with and all were destroyed in seconds. After that they ordered burgers and I ordered the wild boar Sloppy Joe, which I thought was decent even after having those small plates which were full of flavor.  If we weren't leaving that day we would have ordered more and would be drinking, but since we weren't I felt like we didn't get the full experience of this place.  I'll make sure to comeback and not be as hungover and tired. Based on the food I give it 4 stars.

I came in on a Sunday around 6pm and this place was super busy but we got seated at the bar immediately. We ordered the chicken skins, the black bean and oxtail, and the gyro tacos. The gyro tacos were the BOMB! So delicious!!!!! The chicken skins got boring after three bites and the oxtail left something to be desired. Im giving this place 4 stars because the service was great and the  ambiance is better. I will def be back and try out some other dishes.

What a find! Great atmostphere, killer drinks, awesome bartender, and the food!

We started with the meat balls w/ foie gras sauce. The seared the meat ball for a firm crust, and that sauce, utterly insane! And bacon jam?! Tried it based on our rockin bartender's suggestion, no dissappointment there! Scallops were killer! And the price? Way more reasonable than many other places with lesser caliber food offerings! 

I also love the fact that it's walking distance from Old Vegas.

I think we passed it... No that's not it... Wait, there? ... 
The place is pretty hard to spot, but don't let that turn you away. It's worth the search! 
Lots of street metered parking available- you don't need to go back to your original meter to add time to it. Any of the meters downtown let you add to your specific spot-just don't forget to keep the receipt with lot/space number on it! 

The restaurant is small and cozy with a full view of the kitchen. It was pretty packed on a Saturday morning- it's not a place you can go to sit and read for hours. 
We ordered the thai chicken flat bread. Not spicy, perfect size for two, not heavy on the cheese. 4/5
The spicy shrimp was a 5/5 for me. Perfect combo of sweet and spicy. 

I don't have an issue with this but.... A couple came in with two screaming kids and were given cold looks from other customers throughout their meal. "Why would you bring your kids here," was said by the couple across from them multiple times and loud enough for them to hear. Carson Kitchen might not be the place to bring them.

OMG I love this place!! I had the jerk turkey burger it had all kinds of flavors inside.  They also have a lot of specialty drinks that are not on the menu you have ask the bartender. They're opening up a patio area on the top of the venue July 4th weekend looking forward to it!

Delicious food at a reasonable price.
The spicy Tator tots are amazing!
The dining area is small, but not stuffy or crowded.
The kitchen is open so we also got to enjoy watching the food as it was prepared.
Only disappointing thing was that their patio was not open when we visited, despite the beautiful weather.

We stopped here for a quick bite on our way to the airport.  We really enjoyed the atmosphere and food.  As an architect I really enjoyed the materials used throughout and the exposed structural elements were well detailed.  The prefab 
freezer wall material for the kitchen and bathrooms was a great touch.  We had the tri color cauliflower and watermelon with feta cheese appetizers.  Each was delicious.  I had the buttered burger and the remainder of my party had the grilled cheese with beef tips and the chicken sandwich.  The service and staff were very accommodating and very friendly.  Highly recommend this restaurant.  Next time I'm in town I'll definitely go back.

I ate here for lunch this afternoon. And then again for Dinner. Enough said.

Amazing staff. Amazing food. Amazing service. Top 5 most memorable places I've been to. Keep it up guys.

Hard to find you'll walk right past it.
But great food. The fried chicken skins uhmmm.

What a fun place for dinner in Las Vegas! Priced well with great service and a staff that truly believes in the food and atmosphere.  With an ever changing menu, it's tough to make recommendations.  With that said, the beet salad was as good as I have had and the bacon relish/jelly is one of a kind. Oh and a great soundtrack full of energy!  Atmosphere is awesome.

The reviews did not disappoint.  I had the jerk turkey burger and my husband had the butter burger.  Mine was better than I expected.  Tasted nothing like a ground turkey burger.  The jerk spices really set it off and the coleslaw was a nice touch.  We will return the next time we're in town.
In the top ten of the Vegas valley.  Don't miss the great service and great food. Very reasonable prices.  If you've not been - go. Now.

This place was AMAZING!!! There was not an item on the menu that we didn't wanna try!!  We ended up getting the crispy chicken skins, bacon jam, deviled eggs, turkey burger, and bread pudding. ALL amazing!! ONLY thing I'd say is that the bacon jam could be a bit... baconier? And it could use more Brie! But still. DELICIOUS!! And Felicia the bartender MADE our experience! She's a foodie to the CORE just like me so I trusted all her suggestions!! She was spot on with everything. And the cocktail she made (margadian?) was perfectly balanced and delish. Anytime we come back to Vegas, we will come here!! I can't say enough good about it!

So not easy to find but very much worth the effort to look. Took the Yelp suggestion and it was as good as the reviews state.  We tried the Grilled Cheese with tots and Mushroom Flatbread. Tots were so crunchy with zesty seasoning.  Flatbread crispy and mushrooms were so good.

Cute little place in downtown next to Donut Bar. I got the Mac N Cheese and Turkey burger with cole slaw. Amazingly good and very flavorful! Sat at the bar, great and fast service! I would totally go back.

Carson Kitchen was awesome! One block off of Freemont St. in a renovated old motel. Funky courtyard while you wait...everyone really friendly.  Share several small plates for a meal.  Fried chicken skins...always the best part of the chicken...crispy and salty with a smoked honey dipping sauce...outstanding!  Bacon jam with baked Brie came out bubbling in a little cast iron pan...sweet and bacony...unbelievably good.  And the Gyro taco's were the best taco's I have ever had.The beet salad was a refreshing mix.Say Hi to Geronimo...a great bartender.
One of our top five finds ever!

Okay. Some of the things we ordered were awesome and some were mediocre at best. My favorite was the bacon jam with Brie. They brought us out 4 small slices of banquette twice and charged us $2 each time. The restaurant has a cool vibe. We threw down $70 at lunch for 4 of us and left still hungry. Probably won't be coming back.

Good food, good service but very noisy; too noisy to carry on a meaningful conversation but fine for general drinks and partying. That's not a fault as this is their apparent intent. Not the place for a business meeting of any significance. The one comment I have about their tacos is they are way overly salted; like pucker level salt that kills the nice taste.  I also had the meatballs and jalapeno poppers and they were excellent!  I'll go back for drinks and apps.

Great find during our stay downtown Vegas we were referred to this place and thought we'd give it a try checked out on Yelp and everyone had positive things to say. Wife had turkey burger which was a bit spicy but very good, I had the chicken sandwich and both came with excellent tater tots. We sat at bar looking into kitchen and was amazed how well the staff works together and quite efficient. Their personalities and communication was great. Great staff. And with the kitchen view we got to see many great dishes go out. So we went back following day for lunch we had the lamb tacos, mushroom flatbread pizza, and the tempura green beans with an awesome sauce, and again very satisfied with everything and awesome staff next day to. Great to find a place like this, and everything that leaves the kitchen looks very appetizing.

Had dinner at Kerry Simon's new Carson kitchen in downtown Las Vegas last night. Tried a wide variety of things and everything was excellent. Great atmosphere, outstanding service, and my favorite dishes were the empanadas, the short rib sliders, the meatballs, the chicken thighs, and...well everything was delicious. He did it again. Great job Kerry!!!

Everything we had to eat was good-very good. Service was definitely the low point of our experience, although friendly it was pretty slow. Fried chicken skins are great!  The chicken thighs were delicious but a bit pricey. Same goes for the empanadas. The bacon jam, short rib sliders and brownie dessert were ok but I don't think I'd order any of them again. I think Carson Kitchen did well enough for me to recommend it to my friends.
A little pricey, but great food and ambiance overall. A great place to start your evening if you out for a night on Fremont St.
Great vibe, delicious food, warm and welcoming staff. Perfect dining experience every time. Love this place.

First woman told us there were no tables or bar space whatsoever............we were leaving and the manager grabbed us and told us we could have bar seats upstairs and maybe a table. No AC, but we didn't want to have to try and find somewhere else to eat .
Very good manager.
Got some crispy chicken skins which I thought were really good. Shrimp......ok. Mac & cheese ........bomb! Nice mixed drinks as well!

I've gotten takeout from Carson Kitchen while driving through Vegas from Utah to LA, and I was pleased with what I got. Following Yelp's recommendations (of course), I got:

- Bacon Jam: 3 stars. Don't get me wrong; the jam itself is amazing. A great combination of balsamic reduction and smokey bacon flavor. The texture is great and the combination with the baked brie is wonderful. Unfortunately, the "toasted baguette" made it difficult to enjoy the jam and cheese. The slices were so dry and hard that it made chewing a chore. If I were to eat here again (and assuming they offer fresh bread at the table), I would eat it with the fresh bread instead.

- Gyro Tacos: 5 stars. I am a gyros fan. Big-time. Lamb is my preferred meat, and if you roast it over a spit, you are my favorite. I loved the idea of sticking the lamb, tzatziki, and toppings on a corn tortilla. Delicious combination; I highly recommend it.

- Glazed Donut Bread Pudding: 4 stars. I love donuts and I love bread pudding, but I remember this being a bit dry for my taste in spite of the three rum caramel and vanilla creme anglaise they gave me on the side. I expect that I would have preferred it in-house, where they pour the caramel and creme anglaise over the warm bread pudding and impart more moisture. I, however, ate it dipping-style in the car.

Thank you, Carson Kitchen, for a solid meal!
Totally inspired restaurant,  we loved all their dishes. Best restaurant in Vegas which we visited
Delicious and right next to Donut Bar. Bring some $$$$ because this little place is not cheap.

The service was great!  We called ahead to get our name on the list because it is a very desirable restaurant.  It opened 2 years ago.  Most of the items on menu are shareable because you order a la carte.  The sea bass was succulent and the expresso seasoned sirloin was delicious.  We ordered the beet salad, it came with pistachio covered goat cheese and mandarin oranges.  We also ate the chicken skin and honey as an appetizer.
My daughter had the short rib grill cheese with tater tots.  It was very flavorful with a generous portion.

Super disappointing. Hard to give a rating since I didn't get to eat anything. 6 person table, 5 got dinners, 1 never came. I understand mistakes happen, but the restaurant handled it very poorly. Even after the first manager, the only offer was to comp the meal never received and then for a free dessert. Thanks for not making me pay for food I never got! And not really interested in dessert when I never got dinner. For what seems like a cool restaurant, I would have expected a mistake like this to be handled better. Was really looking forward to this dinner but now wouldn't recommend the restaurant.

Update: I appreciated a quick response by restaurant owner to learn more about the situation and try to make it right. Still frustrated over my experience since it seemed like there was little priority that night to fix a problem. A meal was missed and the rest of my party was long done with their plates cleared and still no missing meal. However, I realize mistakes do happen and I appreciate the owners follow up. Everyone else's food looked great - hopefully processes change.

Everyone seems to love this spot, there's honestly nothing special about it. We were here for dinner and it was super busy, we sat at like a big kitchen table with strangers and yelled for the whole night in an attempt to have a conversation. The drinks were whack. The food was OK. We ordered a bunch of tappas but nothing really stood out. I wanted to really like this place but... no.

I have been to this restaurant for business Meetup, social gathering and romantic date night. And I gotta say its one of my favourite spot downtown. 

The rooftop patio is cool. 

I also recommend this place frequently to visitors who wants to get away from the strip, but looking for a casual yet trendy place to eat at.

Honestly, this place doesn't even deserve a 1  star rating. I Just had the worst first impression for a restaurant at Carson's Kitchen. At  arrival we weren't greeted with a warm welcome. We were seated at a high top that seats about 6-10 people and requested to sit in a lower table. The place was very empty and the host sat us at a vertical two top. When me and my boyfriend requested to sit next to each other at a four top, she mentioned to us she wouldn't be able to seat us there because if there was a large party they would need the table. Take in mind this place was empty. When we sat at the two top, my boyfriend moved along the side and the server rudely told my my boyfriend he couldn't sit next to me! At that point we were so shocked and upset that we just ended up leaving. 
First impressions are everything in any business, and this place has the worst hospitality. If their service was that bad, I can only imagine how they handle their food they serve.

The rooftop dining area was awesome but the service wasn't the best.  The waitress just seemed annoyed we were even there.  My friends and I were told we just HAD to try the bacon jelly, due to the fact who isn't a bacon lover? Well... it was just OK but the worst part about it was there wasn't enough bread accompanied with the amount of jelly served so we had to continue to ask for more, which is another reason why the waitress seemed annoyed.  I'm a HUGE mac and cheese fan so I had to order it... once again, super bland.  I had a great time cause the weather was perfect and my company was the best.  Maybe it was just an off night for everyone there (but for a busy Saturday night I expected more).  Maybe I'll try it again...

This amazing restaurant is not to be missed. The service is right-on with our server explaining the menu as there were 4 of us and we wanted to try many items. The burnt ends, watermelon salad, beet salad, macaroni & cheese, flatbreads, fried green beans and so many other dishes were awesome. Also, the desserts are not to be missed! What a find! Looking forward to my next visit!

A good place to come eat and chat with friends. We came with empty stomachs on a Monday afternoon around 4-5 on Labor Day to try the place we have seen so many reviews about. We were seated right away and were attended to promptly. Service was good but the portions were very small compared to the price we paid and some of the stuff was a bit salty but the flavor was good. 

We ordered:

Tempura Green Beans: This was the absolute surprise of the day. Tempura green beans are exactly how they sound but the pepper jelly cream cheese they served it with was so good!. The creaminess of the cheese with the sweetness of the pepper jelly complimented the mild flavor of the green beans. Although a bit oily for me, it was nevertheless, my favorite dish. Good portion

Cocoa- Expresso crusted Steak- It was very salty in my opinion. The crust itself was very salty on the end pieces but for the middle slices, it worked well. The meat was good. I would have preferred it a bit more rare but it was good the way they served it. 

Rabbit Ragu- This was very good. The rabbit was cooked well with crunchy pieces of pancetta? or was it rabbit? Either way, the sauce worked well with the meat and complimented the spaghetti squash. Portion was super small in my opinion for the $12? $14 dollars I paid. If i really crave it, i would order it again but I think I'll opt for something else next time. 

Hawaiian Flat Bread- Flatbread served with spiced rum pineapple and ham, sprinkled with chives. It was alright. The pineapple was delicious. It was a very bold and sweet flavor. The ham however, was salty and overpowered the pineapple which was a shame. Also a bit pricey but it's Vegas so I can't say anything there. 

Overall it was a good experience. Good food although a bit salty and great customer service. Will be back to try other food on the menu!

One of the restaurants that is part of the new downtown. I only had a drink there so I can't really tell you about the food, other than it looked great. The drink was very good. This joint is a tad off the beaten path and can be a little difficult to locate via GPS, but hey isn't that half the fun? Not really. If you do happen to find it, it's worth a stop in. Please tell me how the rather delicious looking food is. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

Carson Kitchen has always been one of my favorite lunch spots. They recently changed the menu and got rid of my favorite items "Burnt Ends". They now have a MMM Rib sandwich but without the best dill sauce ever it doesn't even compare. The other downside of Carson is that all the seating is either high tops or backless chairs so it's a hard place to take anybody with any physical limitations. I really hope they bring back the Burnt Ends or at least the dill/ranch dressing that came with it.

I rarely ever leave the strip when I visit Vegas, however, it's now a MUST to hit up Carsons Kitchen. Everything is perfect about this restaurant! The staff is amazing, drinks are creative and delicious, and food is just perfect. Is hands down my favorite restaurant in all of Vegas now!!!

We came here off a recommendation from our local friend. I saw bacon jam with baked Brie on the menu, immediately shut down my computer and hopped in a Lyft. So happy we did. This place was delicious! The red snapper with panang curry, Mac and cheese, bacon jam and devils eggs are all must gets! Also, I was so pleasantly surprised by the chicken skins. Really, everything we had was delicious. 

The service was amazing. Super personable, funny and made the experience. We came deep and they found us a table very quickly. Bonus tip- they didn't take reservations, but they did allow us to call ahead to put our name in. 

Also, let's be honest. Downtown is way better than the strip anyways.

What a great little surprise in old downtown Las Vegas! You may feel more like you're in San Fran or SoHo but zero pretentiousness. Gyro Tacos amazing, Bacon Jam amazing, cocktails amazing... I'm in love!!!

Great food, great drinks, great atmosphere, and great service make for a great night out. 

We arrived and were told it would be a short wait. No worries, we were able to grab drinks at the bar and wait out back in the courtyard. The hostess said she would find us when our table was ready and that she did. 

The drinks to start were very good and the drink menu had some unique options. The food menu offers small plates as well as entrees. We opted to order a variety of food items and share. The waiter let us know that food comes out as it is prepared so sharing is really the best way to go.

The Gyro Tacos were very good. We almost asked for a second order of these. The meat was well seasoned and the pita was both soft and crispy perfection. The Devil's Eggs were delicious. The Baked Mac & Cheese was cheesy and had a nice truffle flavor without being overwhelming to the dish. The serving looked like it was on the smaller side, but was oddly filling. The Jerk Turkey Burger was another great item. The jerk flavor was nice and the mango slaw paired nicely with the spice in the seasoning. I enjoyed the tots on the side, but they weren't spicy as described on the menu.

Service was on point. We were greeted as soon as we sat down, waters were refilled, and the waiter took care to explain menu items so there weren't any surprises. The employees worked as a team to get food to the table and empty plates cleared.

Loved this little gem of a spot!! 

We stopped by to grab a bite after the Sunday matinee showing of Book of Mormon at the Smith Center.

Bacon jam...amazing!! Crispy Chicken Skins...salty slices of heaven which are served with a smoked honey for dipping. (These are MUST try items!!!!)

We also had the short rib sliders, the beet
salad and the Devil's Eggs (4 deviled egg halves with crispy pancetta and caviar on top....OMG!!)

Plus I tried two delicious cocktails 

Brewer's Fix:
Hop head vodka, apricot preserves, fresh lemon, simple syrup, prosecco 

The Magarian:
Aviation gin, thyme & honey syrup, fresh lemon, mr. q cumber soda

Not easy to find....the door is actually ON Carson Street not on 6th. 

This place is tiny, so I'm quite sure that if you go on a busy weekend during prime noshing hours, you'll have to wait. I will tell you, it is WORTH the wait!!

Next time I'm trying the Butter Burger and the Mac & Cheese.

I went to Carson Kitchen for dinner fairly soon after they first opened and I have to say their food was really good.  I kept it simple with a flat bread and the deconstructed donut dessert and they were both really good. 

Recently I had occasion to join a friend there for lunch and was treated to food that was even better than in their early days. Sure, different menu items, but it felt like they had dialed things in a bit and the sliders and the deviled eggs that we had were really really good. 

To top if off, the people working there are extremely friendly and on top of their game, overall I would say this is a really great addition to downtown fare and you should definitely check it out, especially if you're looking for a new lunch spot.

Walked to Carson Kitchen after getting a tattoo at Downtown Tattoo on Fremont. Lunch was delicious. We started with tempura green beans and cocktails both of which were great! We shared the lamb tacos and Mac and cheese and loved it. Our friends had bison sliders and a jerk turkey burger and we're happy with their food as well. I would definitely recommend Carson Kitchen - great food and drinks and much better prices than on the strip.
delish burger...a little slow, but I did request my meat well done.  Otherwise, on point.  :)  If I have the time in the future to go, I will.  It really fills up for lunchtime, so go a bit early.

Before heading to the Smith Center to watch Beauty and the Beast we stopped at Carson Kitchen for an early dinner. We were seated in about 20 minuets, the wait was worth it! We had the deviled eggs, bacon jam, burn ends and Mac & cheese. They were all great, you mush mix the bacon jam with the Mac & cheese they make a great combination. We will be back to spend more time to enjoy this place.
The food was amazing with great service . You will leave feeling happy and satisfied.   A must place to eat and relax .

If you don't have a reservation, get one. Seating is very limited/shared and that's what makes it so special. Food comes out fresh and fast. If you do have to wait, their outdoor seating is really cozy and comfortable.
Once we were seated, we order my go to, the bacon jam and the mushroom flatbread. The bacon jam is one of my favorite things on the planet and is covered with one of my other favorite things on the planet, Brie. The mushroom flatbread was just as good with a nice balance of mild and vinegary mushrooms. Definitely a good choice if you're a foodie or open to interesting menu items.

If you're anywhere in the Vegas area do yourself a favor and hit up downtown. Carson kitchen is a diamond in the rough down there. Get the bacon jam, chicken skins, mac, green beans, and risotto. And when you're too full from all of that get the glazed donut bread pudding. Can't go wrong with any of the cocktails either. It's literally the totally package. The GM is the shit and the servers are bomb. You won't regret your experience. "Kerry on"!
Excellent service and something unexpectedly yummy! Was seated right away and despite the somewhat strange menu choices, was pleasantly surprised.

Awesome service, unbelievable food. It is a must if you are in the Fremont area. 

We had the bacon jam spread -share it (they will suggest sharing)

Shared a burger. Grass fed. Special sauce and cheese. Unreal taste and flavor. Put the left over jam on it. 


Very nice people and fast.

I can't even begin to tell you how good this place is.  The place is tiny yet impeccably designed, from it's rustic tabletops to industrial/modern lighting.  The bar stools were a little uncomfy but I didn't let that sway me.  The food more than made up for it with its intense blend of flavors which left my palate craving more.  I'm already planning what we will have on our second visit.

The ambiance, service, and food get an A+.  Don't let the crowds scare you away.  Your stomach will thank you for it later.

Definitely an interesting place. The food is good and unique. It's a cool, hip, trendy type place. Worth visiting once for sure, but I wouldn't eat here more than maybe once a year. Why? Well, to be honest; there are just too many places in Vegas that have better food for the money. Carson Kitchen isn't extremely expensive, but the portions are small and if you want to try various things (you should), it adds up. We probably could have eaten at a pretty nice steakhouse for the price we paid. Service was good. We were on the roof which was cool cuz the weather was awesome, but I don't know how that will be in the summer. 

Bottom line: Neat place with good food, but you could get a better "traditional" meal for the price.

Everything about this restaurant is on point. I went in to eat on Thursday afternoon and started with the broccoli salad and I could not stop eating it. I also had the jerk turkey burger and it was so moist and full of flavor. Seasoned and cooked to perfection. I cannot wait to go back. So much to try! The staff is very friendly. Our server was very attentive and very descriptive of the menu.

Came in about 45 minutes prior to close and were seated immediately, as the place had cleared out from earlier.  The bartender was super friendly and efficient.  I am docking for 1 star though b/c we did, in general, feel a bit rushed overall, and he wouldn't make any more iced tea for me, saying "Sorry, we are all out"...and this was way before close.  Our food was very good.  We will return.

Try the tempura green beans, short rib sliders and bread pudding made with glazed donuts from O Face next door  - ahhhhhmazing!  Might be a long wait to get a seat but totally worth it! Staff is exceptional and food was out of this world!  Call ahead seating available, no reservations unfortunately. Outdoor seating will be available once it cools down - looking forward to it!

I felt like we lucked into the most amazing seats in the house--at the bar right in front of one of the chefs who was responsible for the cold dishes and flatbreads. He even took some time to chat with us. Watching the three chefs work together was enough to keep me in my seat all night. Talk about a well-oiled machine! 

Our food was pretty good, but the theme was that it was all a little spicy (which is usually not an issue for me). Since we got to watch them make things up close and personal, we noticed either paprika or cayenne as a frequent addition, and we tasted it, too. The best thing we ate was the short rib grilled cheese, which was absolutely delicious and buttery. We also split the bacon jam (the spicy element here was in the liquid base), which came with lots of bread for dipping, but probably less brie than I was expecting. We also got the rainbow cauliflower.

They have a lovely back patio that was nice to relax on while we were waiting for a table. The staff was super pleasant, and the prices were perfectly reasonable. The food came out tapas style (and quickly). I'm glad we came here if for no other reason than our awesome view!

Everything we had was delicious.  We had the oxtail risotto, crispy chicken skin, mac n cheese, butter burger, bone in pork belly,  veal meatballs,  bacon jam, and bacon bourbon brownie. Everything came out quickly and was properly cooked. I will back back very soon.
I don't normally eat dessert, but get the donut bread pudding. Just do it and you will not regret it.

This place pretty much will sum up the transformation that has gone on downtown in the last 3-5 years. The amount of seating space is minimal so plan on a wait almost anytime you go.  You may find a seat at the bar but don't count on it.  The patio out back is lovely but the summer heat doesn't make it so appealing, but the most recent time I was there...I didn't mind the heat because the set up is so "clean" that it didn't away from the feel of the place. 

The servers wear rock band tshirts but all Pop bands from the 60s onward....I think I remember Beastie Boys, but that's an interesting twist.  

The bill comes in some beatnik style book that people sign like its a bead and breakfast "been here" book. 

The food is so good but it's heart attack food.  Bacon jam and bacon ice cream which is amazing is obviously not what the healthy Vegans are ordering and it's got a Tapas style serving feel which is may in fact be a Tapas restaurant and I just don't know.  

Downtown is coming back.....if it was hip...and Carson Kitchen is the best restaurant down there as far as amazing food and ambiance.  Health wise...no way, but that's why you eat out.  Enjoy!!

So glad I did my homework and knew to look for this small place.  It reminds me of a hipster joint in Logan Square (Chicago) but do NOT let that deter you!
I was pleasantly surprised in the yummy and healthy options. (I ordered falafel sliders). When we got home from our vacation, my husband kept talking about the chicken skins he ordered and how much he wanted them.  I had tasted one.  Even the BREADING was damn good.

For the record I never got to actually eat a meal, and here's why: we sat at the bar and were perusing the menu when one of the chefs dropped a tub of lettuce and the lid. Thankfully none of the lettuce spilled out but the lid landed on the floor with the inside flooring facing. He picked it up off the floor and placed the lid on the full tub of lettuce. Not thank you, I refuse to pay $10 for a salad that has sat all day rubbing up against something that fell on the dirty ass floor. I will never return here and need to tell everyone I know to do the same.

UPDATE: they've made certain to threaten me through personal message. I'm supposed to let you all know after he put it back in the fridge, some time later the lettuce was taken to the back and water was run over it. So no worries. It was only exposed to the floor for a bit and I don't know what I'm talking about. There, is that right? Did I say what I was supposed to, will you not threaten me again? Thanks.

gotta LOVE this customer service (below)

The man and I WASTED too much money on the strip paying for fine dining. As a foodie, THIS IS THE ONLY PLACE YOU NEED TO GO. get the damn burger. I don't typically eat burgers but this burger is amazing.... get the deviled eggs. Ain't like my momma makes it in the south but damn good. The mac and cheese wasn't my style but it was ok. All in all, wish we would have eaten here for several meals so we could have tried more things on the menu!!

This place is an absolute gem. Plus you're outgoing to pay the text prices like the strip. The place has killer food and an awesome staff. Plus they all get he wear T-Shirt of bands. There nothing to recommend because everything I have had has been fantastic. So go for your flavor of the night, you will not be disappointed.

Chow!

Our Lyft driver suggested this place for a bite to eat and to make sure to get the bacon jam! He claimed it to be the best food in Downtown Las Vegas. We had our doubts by what the outside looked like. But decided to take chance, and the ambiance on the inside was very intimate and cool. We had a great experience and meal. Shared the bacon jam, BBQ Burt ends, and veal meatballs (our favorite). I would highly recommend this place too!
Great find in Vegas, cool, hip and fun. Tapas style with contemporary feel, fish to Mac n cheese, cauliflower to flatbread.  If your not cool or into new things, don't come here!

The place is small and there is still a bit of miscommunication but I'm sure they will work it out.  The food is outstanding.  First time, I had the Turkey burger and it was spicy but delicious.  The tatter tots were great.   Came back and sat outside.  A bit hot even at night but enjoyable.  Will be nicer as it cools a bit.  Order gyro taco and chicken skins.  Both were excellent.  Friend ordered sliders which were "not bad."

Skip the over-priced over-hyped hotel restaurants and come try Carson Kitchen.  My wife and I had dinner there last Friday and it was terrific.  We sat at the bar in front of the kitchen which was entertaining and gave us the opportunity to speak briefly with a cook.  

The staff were all very friendly and attentive.  The drinks from the bar were excellent.  We had their version of a margarita and a drink with sage in it.  Both were creative and tasty.  

The menu was also very innovative.  Our favorite dishes were the green eggs and ham flat bread and the veal meat balls with foie gras cream sauce.  Naughty, but superb.  

If I owned a restaurant this is how I would hope to do it.  Can't wait to go back.
Butter burger, no bun was the best burger I've had in a long time. Everything we ate was perfect. Standing ovation.

A hidden gem just off the beaten path of Freemont street. Tapas style restaurant that allows you to try as much as you want! Friendly staff who are truly passionate about serving up dishes that are a little different. The chicken skins are a must have, served with smoked honey. My mouth is watering just writing this review! The deviled eggs with caviar, even the beet salad with pistachio rolled goat cheese!!! Don't know what you want? This place has it! You just don't know it yet...

Did not live up to it's hype. 

I've heard about Carson Kitchen from many friends and coworkers which made it exciting when I finally decided to go. It's literally a little hole in the wall which I love, and the inside is small with a very cozy ambiance. We were seated at the corner of a large rectangular table, seats away from a couple. 

We ordered the jalapeño poppers and the deviled eggs for appetizers. The deviled eggs were great (a little on the saltier side though) with large bits of bacon on top. The jalapeño poppers were larger than I would have liked. I had to use a fork and knife but would have rather popped small bites into my mouth. It also was not as cheesy as I was hoping for. 

I ordered the buffalo chicken pizza and was very disappointed. For some reason it tasted more like a taco pizza. Although there were bits of chicken, I'm almost positive there was some ground beef on there too. Strange.

My friends ordered the NY strip steak and the baked mac and cheese. They weren't impressed by the steak but enjoyed the mac and cheese. 

We had a male server who was great. Nothing to complain about the service.

I honestly won't be coming back because I wasn't impressed by the food, which was what I was really looking forward to trying. I took the pizza to go to originally bring it back to my roommate but I ended up giving it to a homeless man on Fremont St.
The meat is awesome, also de eggs. The tempura beans are surprisingly delicious. Very good service.

First time I visited Carson Kitchen it was the new guy on the Downtown block. The restaurant, since its incarnation has seen great praise, on Yelp, in local Las Vegas scenes, and has even gone national.

There is no doubt the food here is good, inspired, and not your typical grub. Carson Kitchen is for a day when you feel like splurging on veal meatballs topped with foie gras cream, which I did and they were absolutely delightful. This dish is pleasant and warming, like Swedish meatballs, a dish you might imagine your Grammy serving you on a cold winter night. But the foie cream is what gives it that Carson Kitchen difference.

Crispy chicken skins and honey dipping sauce. Pretty much one of the last meals you need to eat before you die and leave this Earth. Good eats and simple eats. The portion is also good for the price.

Bison sliders offer up a meaty variation on your old beef burger sliders. These should not be missed as they have a tangy BBQ sauce that melds oh so happily with the lean bison burger. Paired up with some crispy tater tots, and you have yourself a winner.

Service was decent, some hit or miss spots here and there. But at least they were willing to split the bill between myself and my friend this time. 

Lunch time is best in my opinion, but get there early or you'll be waiting, or you may not even get to eat, depending on how long your lunch break is.

Solid Downtown eatery. I will be back.

My wife and I just tried this spot on a rare rainy Friday night here in Vegas. Because of the rain we had to sit inside, which is fairly small but well laid out. It's also mostly communal seating, which I'm not a fan of, but the tables are wide enough that you aren't shoved up in someone else's face. Unfortunately, the tables only have about 6" of overhang and are completely solid underneath, which is a bit uncomfortable when you're over 6' tall.

The food is great and the prices are reasonable for what you get. We started with the crispy chicken skins, which were expectedly amazing. I mean, come on! All our lives we're told not to eat the skin (which we all know is the best part) because it's "not healthy".  Well here, they give you a whole bowl of just that with a side of smoked honey. It's fantastic. 

Then we got the Bacon Jam, which is arguably what made us want to eat here in the first place. My wife absolutely loved it, but shockingly, I wasn't overwhelmed by it for some reason. It's a sizzling cast iron plate of bacon and brie cheese, how could I not love that?!? Oh well, that's a mystery for another time.

Next we shared the Jerk Turkey Burger, which was back to amazing, for both of us this time. It's flavorful, juicy, tender and just spicy enough. The burger came with a side of spicy tater tots which were delicious also. 

Finally we shared the Glazed Donut Bread Pudding. This was decidedly mediocre for both of us. Just a big, doughy, plop of undercooked cake soaked in butter and caramel. Sounds like it would be great but it had next to no flavor. 

For drinks we both had "Drinks With the Mrs" which were excellent. Refreshing but just strong enough. 

Overall, it's a solid 4 stars and we'd definitely come again to try some more of the menu.

I love this place! Friendly and attentive staff, and deliciously creative food. Stopped in for a quick bite and really enjoyed the fantastic Gyro Lamb Tacos & Veal Meatballs. I look forward to returning to explore more of the menu.

A group of 10 of us had an incredible meal at Carson Kitchen. We couldn't choose our favorite dish because everything was great. I'd also highly recommend the Get Shorty cocktail.  Service was helpful and fast. Best meal I've had in Vegas.

I decided to try this place over a meeting to finalize some plans for work and my god was I impressed! I had the coco espresso strip cooked rare. It was fantastic and amazing. Truly wish I could order an endless amount. I had it with a side of Rainbow Cauliflower which was a mistake on my end. That is the only thing wrong with this place. I enjoyed a drink of a special of theirs called Towns End. It's a twist on an old fashioned. It was good but nothing to brag about. But when it comes to bragging. They have something I feel they don't brag enough about. This one dessert called the Bourbon brownie. Simply just wow. That's all you can say. The brownie is just so rich and the hints of bourbon are balanced just well enough where they don't overpower the ice cream or the chocolate. It is a must get!

I ate here over the weekend and was so happy to have finally tried this restaurant.  The tenderloin empanadas were unbelievably delicious.  I loved the eclectic menu and also the choice of wines by the glass.  The vibe of this place is awesome.  I can't wait to return!

Hard to find, but well worth the effort. Barmaster Andrew made for the perfect night, with specialty cocktails created on the fly. We dove into the apps, and they inspired us to try things at home. All around great experience...

Fantastic! Great food. Wonderful staff. Just awesome, as always. Had super yummy squid ink spaghetti, steak so tender I literally cut it with a fork, and the yummiest cauliflower ever. Lovely date night, waiting just a bit with drinks by the fire pit until the staff could thoughtfully accommodate us and our baby at a table.

I would give them 5 stars for sure if this woman chef wasn't staring at me the entire time I was eating. I was extremely uncomfortable and it takes a lot for me to feel that way. I usually have a great experience here (Nicole is always such a pleasure and so sweet) but today was miserable. The chef kept talking crap about EDC crowds (I'm here to work the event, not party but I do have colored hair). I just didn't like the fact that she went out of her way to stare at me AND my girlfriend for the entire duration of our meal.... I didn't get her name but here's a photo. I love you guys though!

I tried a few things - the rainbow cauliflower, young beets, the black rice &a oxtail risotto, and the butter burger

Overall - a complete let down. I was expecting much more. I think the excitement comes from the fact that the dishes are more unique, but the dishes themselves do not own up.

Cauliflower - garlic & lemon juice, not too hard to ruin
Beets - was decent, nothing special. I would expect the veggies to be nice and cold and refreshing
The oxtail risotto - STICKY and THICK mess. It tasted like it was a few days old. I'm not sure where they are going with this
Burger - takes the win because the meat was good

Such a fantastic experience!! Very hip spot on Carson and LV Blvd. I came for my parents anniversary dinner. The place was packed! There were 7 of us and we were seated quickly upstairs on there rooftop patio. We ordered tons of things. Oxtail Risotto which was superb, blackened sea bass had lots of flavor and cooked perfect. Veal meatballs were delicious. They had a nice sauce and were served with peas. The tempura green beans were fabulous. The ribeye was interesting it was served with a cocoa sauce which went great with it. The falafel sliders was amazing! My favorite was the gyro tacos. They had so much flavor. Too bad you only get three of them. The service was great and prompt. The bring your check out in a book, which I thought was so cool. All in all wonderful experience! Highly recommend!

What a great Valentine's Day dinner. We had the 4 course prix fixe menu with an additional entree. All 8 dishes were amazing, service was great and the wine/cocktail pairing was well matched. Thank you Nichole, Matt, John and to all the staff at Carson. Keep up the great work. KS is very proud!!

I'm very excited to have my first Yelp review be Carson Kitchen. This is a restaurant that I had been wanting to try for a couple months but with being busy with school I hadn't. I was able to experience this restaurant with some of my gf's on First Friday. First of all, it's a cute and chic place located downtown on 6th and Carson. They only take reservations if you have a large party. When we got there at 8PM, they said it would be a 2 hour wait for a party of 3. They don't have those little gadgets that buzz when your table is ready, but they take your phone # and call you when the table is ready.

Ok, time to get to the good stuff. The food here is DELICIOUS and amazing! It's definitely set up so you can share the plates (tapas like) with your party. This evening we ordered: 
* Bacon Jam
o Bacon + Jam + Brie + Bread
o This is a must and also works as a dessert 
* Baked Mac & Cheese
o top 3 Mac & Cheese's I've had in LV
* Rainbow Cauliflower
o Has lime juice and garlic on it, the top is delicious but the bottom got really soggy and was too acidic (lime juice) 
* Young Beets Salad
o Personally not one of my favorites, (the beets tasted like they were canned) but one of my friends favs 
* and a shrimp appetizer
o AMAZING! they were prepared with tempura and had a hint of spice
As far as cocktails, my gf's had the "get shorty!" and enjoyed it, I had a glass of the Grenache but wouldn't really recommend their wine. 

Service was your average from the hostess to the server, the manager or supervisor was the one that was bringing out our food as soon as it was out. 

So for food 5 Stars but Service I would say 4 Stars!

I'm looking forward to going back and maybe celebrating some small milestones there!

Hope this helps!!

We headed over to this cute place on a Wednesday night. It was very busy so we had to wait with many others before us in the outside backyard. That area is very nicely set up with lots of seating. Bummer the upstairs bar was closed so we were waiting without any drinks. We decided to explore the menu (too bad lots of things I saw in Yelp were no longer available - they change their menu a lot which is great for returning customers of course!). After about 30min we were seated by the bar. The one bartender was overwhelmed with work. She apologized and we were totally understanding, she was very friendly when she served us. We ordered drinks and 4 plates.
I had the pink smoking jacket with a real smokey flavor to it. Good! And my partner had the Daaammmmn Daniel but on the rocks, which was fresh and tasted like a lemonade!

Tempura green beans:
Delicious but totally different when combined with the sweet pepper cream cheese. I prefer without but both work. Serious portion! 

Filet ohhh fish:
Very good! Comes with hush puppies and ketchup, yummie!

Rainbow cauliflower:
Good but after a while you are over it. Has a spicy aftertaste and I don't like spicy food but this didn't bother me. It was good but would be great with less salt.

Wild mushroom flatbread:
Yasssss  so good!!!!!! My favorite yummy  

We ordered several dishes because were thinking it's tapas style but nope these are large portions and we had to take home half of it. We were full with 2 for the 2 of us.

AMAZING. Given a suggestion from a bartender at a nearby hotel and I can tell you this place is pure gold. Not a bad item on the menu and Felicia was a fantastic server. This is a must eat at when visiting Las Vegas.

We ate here for lunch a few days ago and while everything tasted great and we enjoyed our lunch, I felt quite sick later that night and thought I may have eaten contaminated food.  I called the next morning to report that I was quite sick and wondered if they had received other complaints and the woman who answered told me the owner would call me back.  I never received a return call, however when I posted my experience about this, the owner immediately sent me an apologetic note and gave me some information about contaminated food and informed me that they have never had a complaint so I am re-writing my earlier post. The owner seemed very earnest and likely did not receive the message from his employee.

Finding the front door was a little tricky, but it was all good after that.
We had the chicken skins and deviled eggs as appetizers. I wasn't super crazy about the chicken skins, but my husband loved them. They have a honey dipping sauce that goes very well with the fried chicken skins.
The deviled eggs were FABULOUS! 
My husband had the short rib sliders, they were very good.... a little dry, but very tasty.
I had the fried green tomato sandwich, it has crab meat and a really delicious tarter sauce that blended the tastes of the sandwich beautifully. Loved it!!
Great food in a fun downtown Las Vegas location with very friendly and helpful staff.

This was the best meal I've ever had. Be sure to try something new and ask the staff for recommendations. We had the cheeseburger, tri-colored cauliflower and brownie with ice cream and bacon. Delish!

Thankfully not on the strip.....this place is a  hidden gem. Great cocktails and beer selection. Chicken sandwich was one of the best I've had. Tasted like home cooking with each dish we ordered. Great flavours! Tasty food to be sure. Very cool little vibe and cool music flowing.
We found them on Yelp and the staff was so welcoming to this establishment. The meal was off the hook and helped me pair a nice wine. I will come back when I go to Vegas again

This was a great brunch spot close to downtown (within walking distance), and driving distance from the strip. Apparently they get very busy and don't take reservations, so plan ahead. We got there just as they opened at 11:30am on a Sat, and our party of 6 was able to be seated right away.

We got the following:
Bacon jam ($13): highly recommend this. It comes with toasted baguette and this delicious bacon savory spread with Brie cheese. So good.
Baked Mac and cheese ($13): another sharable side. The truffle flavor wasn't as strong as in other Mac and cheeses I have had, and the serving size was a bit on the small side. It was very good with the bacon jam on top though.
Gyro tacos ($12): would probably skip this next time. They had a nice Greek flavor to them with lamb, tzatziki, and feta, but didn't wow me.

I also got the butter burger ($14), which was a pretty filling burger. I liked that they came with tator tots, which was a nice change from the usual fries.

Their desserts looked super tasty as well, but we were too full to try them. Next time!

Experience:  I have been waiting and waiting to try this place. I kept missing the nights out when my friends were going. So, here I am with about a group of 7. 

Facility:  the inside is very small, but it was a beautiful Vegas night, so we sat on the balcony.  Was quite a walk around for the elevator, but stairs are easy access. The balcony seems to have more room, but it might be because it's open air. Upstairs has some bench seating and chairs. 

Service: when I first walked in, I asked how to get to the balcony and a very nice lady (Suzanne) walked me all the way around to the elevator and up to the top. Our waiter (Roman) was friendly, attentive and accommodating. 

Food:  wow!  So, we ordered a bunch of dishes to share.  Seems like most portions are on the small side.  Here's what we had:
Gyro tacos - 4/5 - very good. Crispy "shell" made from pita, very good tzatziki and good lamb.
Crispy chicken skins - 5/5 - crispy, slightly spiced skins almost cooked like pork skins, and served with honey for dipping.  The perfect blend of salty/savory and sweet. 
Bacon Jam - 5/5 - the bread was perfectly toasted and the jam was sweet and delicious with a hint of bacon. Brie was kinda unnecessary, because the jam overpowers it. 
Devils eggs - 4/5 - good flavors of egg, caviar and pancetta. 
Cheddar crab fondue - 3/5 - good flavor, but almost tasted like canned crab. But I still liked it. 
Mac and cheese - 4/5 - good, cheesey, but a tad runny. 
Glazed Donut bread pudding - 3/5 - if you like sweet donut flavor - yum! Good flavors, but waaaayyyy too sweet for me. 
Bacon Ice Cream - 5/5 - the yummiest!  Ice cream with bits of bacon. 

Overall - this is now my favorite restaurant downtown.  I loved it!  The atmosphere, the service, and, of course, the food. I'll be back!!!!
It's a bit delayed, but I have been here a few times in 2014. Love. Love the cauliflower! I am vegetarian, but here great things about the Bacon Jam...who knew!
Please if you love yourself order the bacon jam the second you are sat. Also chicken skins and tempura green beans, then go from there. This place is AMAZING!

I love to do research before I go out of town to find the perfect places to eat. I don't always make it to all of them based on different circumstances (size of group, activities we're doing, etc) but Carson Kitchen was one of these places and I'm trilled that we actually made it! 

My boyfriend and I got to Carson Kitchen a bit past lunch time after a night of drunken debauchery on the strip and this place really soothed our souls and put us back at peace with the world. Let me start off by saying that the service was incredible! Everyone we spoke to was very friendly, helpful and the kitchen staff got our dishes out at lightning speed! 

Lets get to the nitty gritty of Carson Kitchen though: the food. AMAZEBALLS!! Per advice of our server, we ordered several different dishes to try. Everything was delicious! We ordered the tempura green beans with pepper jelly cream cheese, the veal meatballs with sherry foie gras cream, coco expresso NY strip with red wine demi sauce, black rice oxtail risotto, mac and cheese and of course the glazed donut bread pudding for dessert.  The portions were perfect for the both of us as we devoured about 95% of all the food. Our server even brought us some extra bread to make small bites with the steak and mac and cheese, genius! My boyfriend literally had his mind blown by all of the flavors these dishes had.

Carson Kitchen, I love you. Please come to LA. Specifically Highland Park so I can walk in several times a week and fall in love with you again. In the meantime, I'll see you again in March. I'm counting down the days.

A friend and colleague brought me here for dinner when we were in Vegas fro NAB.  He preps me by telling me this is one of his favorite, chill places in the Fremont District...the food and drinks are great, but that we can expect to wait for a while.

As promised, we walk in and the super-friendly hostess tells us there's about an hour wait, and then invites us to grab a drink from the bar and chill in their outdoor patio.  We opt to walk down the street and grab a drink at another hip spot, so we put our name on the list.

When we get back, there's some lady going absolutely nuclear on the staff at the front door.  She's screaming so loud, she's just about frothing at the mouth and no one can really tell what she's pissed off about.  What was remarkable was that the manager and the hostess were so kind and patient with her...and even though they were trying to settle her down, she still stormed out yelling about how she'll never set foot in there again (Thank God! lol!).

The manager seats us at the counter in front of their huge, beautiful open kitchen (at our request), and apologize profusely for the scene.  He then calls out to the chef to serve us some tasters and small plates from the kitchen, on the house, by way of apology.  We explain that's not necessary...but he insists (super classy!!).  

We then order a couple of first-rate drinks from the bar and spend the next two and a half hours on a delicious journey of culinary greatness!!  Seriously, one of the best, most fun meals I've had in a long time.

Once she realized how into the experience we are, the chef keeps dropping us tasty morsels to try...deep friend chicken skins that were perfectly crispy, salty, oily yumminess...cauliflower bites that were at the same time light and healthy & rich and sinful (how do you do that?!?  Seriously).  Plate after plate of mind blown, tongue tickling satisfaction!!

So yeah...Carson Kitchen gets one of my highest recommendations!!

When you come, expect three things...food that will amaze and surprise, perfect drinks, and a staff that will treat you like instant friends!!

Just know that there's going to be a wait.  And treat the staff kindly.  Don't be that lady...ever.  Just don't!!

Absolutely out of this world delicious. This place has a super creative menu, great atmosphere, impeccable service, and the best part: the food is AMAZING. We ordered the crispy chicken skins with smoked honey dip, gyro tacos, and bacon jam with baked brie. All three things were to die for. Oh! And you absolutely must get their DONUT bread pudding. That's right. Donut. Just do it.

This is a fantastic new place on Carson and sixth next to O face donuts. I have to tell you though we went today at lunch and I think we were exceedingly lucky that we walked in and were able to sit at a table. There was one table that was being saved for somebody with reservations and everything else was literally full it is a tiny little spot. But it is fantastic. We started with the Wellington empanadas which was fantastic.  We then ordered the fried green tomato sandwich with crab and the short rib sliders both came with spicy tater tots. The tater tots were not too spicy you could definitely detect some Paprika and they were quite good. The short rib sliders were quite sweet. The menu does say that they are root beer short rib sliders so take note of that because they are sweet. But the slider was fantastic the sweetness was offset by a crispy onion that was put on the slider. If I had one note it would be to put a little bit more crispy onion to offset that sweetness. The fried green tomato sandwich with crab was the star the tomato is very thickly cut and expertly breaded. The breading has a nice spice to it. Overall it was a fantastic meal it's a little pricey for lunch but I think you have to look at what you get and then you understand the $40 price tag for two people at lunch.  I would love to go back, I hope I get lucky again and get a table!!!

My rule when traveling....don't eat anywhere I can eat in my home city.  Found this gem on YELP while in Vegas and it was an awesome choice.  High quality food perfectly prepared. Bacon Jam, Mac & Cheese and the Jerk Turkey Burger.  Please come to Raleigh we  y'all!

I'm updating my review as I've visited a few more times. My office is very close so I was hopefully this would turn into a regular place, but alas, it's probably not to be.

The second time I went we got seated at the bar. The bar is weirdly designed so you can't scoot your barstool close and the bar doesn't overhang enough. Anyways, I felt uncomfortable and like I was hunched over to reach the bar. So we were seated and a waitress got us water. Then that was it. Staff buzzed around us but no one took our order. After 20 minutes we just left. So weird.

The third time there was an hour+ wait. We left. Get there by 11-11:30 or don't go.

The fourth time we got there at 11:30 & got seated. I asked for a table & the hostess looked uncomfortable since the only table left was a 6-top, but their bar design sucks so I wanted a table. 

Anyways, the food was amazing. I had the fried green tomato crab sandwich. Soooo yummy. I scarfed it. The tomato was really great with the crab. Lots of crab and how ever it's cooked, it's great. A little messy but just delish. My friend got the butter burger. It was huge. It had two cheeses on it and looked like they did a good job of cooking it medium well per her order. The spicy tots were good...a little greesy but I ate them all.

Overall I like this place but go early and they aren't winning points for service. I'd mark them lower for the terrible service but the food is just awesome.

I ate here last year with a friend when I was checking on our rental property. Its in downtown, a previously super shady area which is now slowly improving. The location is still shady. I had a homeless dude sleeping across the glass window from me. The spot is hip and dark. The waiters were super friendly. The food was good. Nice tastes and bold flavors. A bit hipster. I hope all of these downtown businesses thrive and do well.

Exquisite food very well prepared. The sharing concept is great just like home. 

This is a keeper.

DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!!!!! Can I give negative stars??? We called and were told 45-60 minute wait.  We turned up within 15 mins of call as requested. We got drinks from the bar and went out back as instructed to wait for our table.  People were coming outside and seeing how busy it was with people waiting and then stating out loud "I'm glad I gave the guy seating people cash to jump the line...". For example, these two girls who made this statement arrived 40 mins after we did and were sat within 5 minutes, complete bullshit per the wait at that time.... We went back inside after an hour to see where in the list we were.  The "list" had been completely rewritten since our arrival so we couldn't verify this was happening, however, two groups said this and it seems suspicious that the wait list was rewritten.  We were finally sat after 1.5 hours and then were told they were out of 3 or 4 main entrees, so we left in disgust my girlfriend in tears.....

Looking for a new spot to grab a bite/drink and yelp led me to Carson Kitchen. Came here with my wife and bro and we had a great experience. 
Attempted to make a reservation but they only take reservations for large parties. No big deal.  So we walked in and was told there would be a 45 minute wait.  Place looked full and it's not particularly big. 
There's a bar inside and one on the roof. Waiting area was outside in a courtyard/lounge type area.  So we headed to the roof, grabbed a drink, and proceeded to chill in the courtyard. A couple drinks later we were seated inside. 
Placed our food order and another round of drinks. Started off with the chicken skins which were a crunchy delight of fried goodness. Wife ordered the green beans which were as tasty as a green bean could be.
I ordered the Secret Sunday chicken sandwich, which was one darn good tasting sandwich. The accompanying tater tots were consumed by the wife so I'm assuming that they were just as delicious.
My bro ordered the blackened Chilean sea bass and that thing was damn tasty. Perfectly cooked which the right amount of crispness on the blackened side. 
We finished the night with the bread pudding which was on point as any dessert should be.
The waitress was cool,  friendly, and attentive. Don't particularly remember her name but she was excellent.

Not bad place at all. The menu is small but Mighty. Each item of the menu were incredible in their own ways and had very unique flavors. I wish I could have ordered more. So, would be back for sure to try more.

I've always wanted to try this place downtown, and I was not disappointed. Fantastic food with a very hipster atmosphere. The dining is different than other restaurants because the menu is not large, and everything is a la cart, so it is meant for sharing among the people you eat with.

We ordered the rainbow cauliflower, and it was simple, yet really good. I specifically came for their mac and cheese, I saw on other yelp reviews on how good it is, and YES, this is by far the best mac and cheese I have ever tasted. I still dream about it everyday. But if you do not like truffle oil, then it's not for you. It's rich and flavorful, and it's one of their dishes that they are known for. 

10/10 - will definitely be back and will try other items. If you are fond of different flavors together you will love this restaurant. Also, they put a twist on a lot of classic dishes.

It was good, but not as great as I expected it to be. The deviled eggs were the highlight of the meal and I don't even like eggs, but everything else we got was either alright, or worse. 

Short rib sliders- overly sweet and dry

Bacon jam - good, but only comes with enough bread to eat a third of it, either lower the portion and price, or more bread

Empanadas - something about the sauce I didn't agree with, also on the sweet side

I would also recommend going with 4 or more people, seems like that would work out better with the small plate aspect of the menu

This restaurant is another spot that is located in the motel on Carson St. If your not looking for it you would probably miss it. It has two levels and a courtyard where you can wait for your table. There is a bar on both levels. You can dine outside when you are seated on the second level. This place gets busy. We waited 40 minutes for a table on a Tuesday night.

The food was excellent. We had the Coca Espresso NY Strip. It was cooked perfectly to medium rare and the Demi glaze was outstanding. We also tried the Gyro Tacos, which were good.

I will definitely be back to try more menu items. I recommend that you give this place a go.

I'm a resident of downtown and this is one of my go-to's! I've honestly never had a bad meal or service at this joint! Sometime the wait is a bit long but you can just walk down the street and relax for a second. My faves are the bacon jam, veal meatballs and the chicken skins, but pretty much everything on the menu is amazing. The service couldn't be better, and there is always a manager on the floor making sure everything runs smooth

This place was fantastic! The hostess was very friendly, the wait staff was great. I would highly recommend the bacon jam and the mac and cheese. Our table thoroughly enjoyed both. The atmosphere is very relaxed and laid back, a really good find.

The food is amazing. After being on the strip for the past couple of days, our cabbie recommended Carson's Kitchen and it's exceeding our expectations. This would easily be $100+ per person on the Strip. Sorry for the photo, the food went faster than I could get my phone out! We tried all the appetizers (except for the Devils eggs) and most of us got the cocoa strip steak. Gyro tacos were my personal favorite, but every item was loved by all 5 of us.
Carson Kitchen is a gem! My favorite spot in DTLV - great atmosphere, creative menu and fabulous service! It is a must-do in Las Vegas!

That was the best Turkey burger I've ever had, juicy and sweet but also savory and tangy. Loved the tots and the Mac and cheese. We started with the beets which were delicious, fresh and drizzled with honey and grapes. The place has a great vibe, fun, friendly, hip service staff and a great general ambiance. Would HIGHLY recommend.

Yep, the Crispy Chicken Skin & Bacon jam are for sure must orders. They pack so much flavor! And they can be easily shared with 4 people since they're sooo rick. The smoked honey for dipping the skins in is perfect. 

The lamb tacos were just ok. The flour tortilla tastes raw and dry. They could use some sort of treatment. The ground lamb was also kinda dry. Together, I would pass on the tacos. Highly recommend sitting at the open kitchen bar and watch the masters at work. Superb service through the whole meal. What a gem.

Our server Geronimo rocks! Most hospitable and attentive service everrrrr! My two girlfriends and I came here for a late lunch and sat on the upper deck patio on a cool sunny day. We tried as much as we could -- the watermelon salad, the rainbow cauliflower, baked mac & cheese, turkey burger, stroganoff, and the short rib sliders. I washed it down with a nice cold, floral wheat lager (which I'm so bummed I forgot the name Geronimo set me up with ). Let me tell you-- you are missing out if you don't go HAM and try a little of everything. All of the above were great. Watermelon salad -- light, fresh, zesty and with the perfect amount of feta cheese. Rainbow cauliflower -- buttery, crunchy, zesty and visually appealing. Baked mac and cheese -- creamy, tasted like white cheddar Mac and cheese baked with crunchies on it. Stroganoff -- beefy, melt-in-your-mouth type of sensation *just get it*. Short rib sliders -- bite size, meaty, sweet caramelized oniony goodness. I would like to emphasize on the amaaaazing tater tots they serve with the sliders! Have you had hot fries when you were a kid? NOSTALGIA once you pop one of these in your mouth (yeah that's what she said). But no really the seasoning is on point. I have to admit these are THE BEST tater tots I've ever had.
I like their concept, good interior. But all food was too spicy (we had a BBQ jam, cauliflower and NY strip).

This place was recommended and didn't disappoint great service great food fun atmosphere would come back again can't wait to try the whole menu the fried beans were great the burger looked awesome can't wait to come again

5 on the food and 1 on the service. The food is great and very unique, but the server with the mohawk type hair was absolutely rude. We asked about drinks and he just said "no we don't have that" and walked away. GOOD customer service would have been to ask what we were looking for in a beverage and help us find the right one; instead we just got waters and bought no beverages from the bar. The server then was very short with us, barged in and roughly poured water in our cups, and never said thank you. I will NEVER come back to this place if that is how they feel customer service is.

This place is awesome! It was a little hard to find being that there was no huge signage and the streets are dim downtown but it was packed nonetheless for a Wednesday night. Parking is convenient just across the street (paid parking $1.00 every half hour). We arrived an hour and a half before closing and we had to wait for 15 minutes so we grabbed a drink at the bar Molbec red wine for me and the bartender recommended  Bad Beat Hoppy Times IPA for my sister -- which she loved. Prices are reasonable for the drinks. (Total was $16 and change)

There are comfortable bench seats arranged around a fire pit in the back patio which my sister and I occupied as we waited, and we loved and took a lot of pics around :) haha

Our server was friendly enough. He explained the servings a bit and wasn't too pushy when urging us to order a bit more than we did and giving us the option to order more as we go. Sis and I weren't too hungry so we decided to split the Mac n Cheese and the Butter burger.

The Mac n Cheese was so tasty! I told my sis I shoulda ordered another one to go haha it was the perfect amount of cheesy and the bread crumbs on top gave it a light crunch/more flavor! The butter burger was alright, we both agreed, nothing too special. Spicy tater tots were good though! Really wanted to try the bread pudding but we were both stuffed, as we werent too hungry to begin with. The bill came out to be $26.

I really liked the ambiance, and it was intimate. It seemed like the clientele enjoyed the setting as well. I would definitely come back again!

Wow, this place was incredible! From the outside it's unassuming; you might miss it if you're not looking. Once you walk in, the decor is modern and rustic. We were blown away at the stellar service... From the person who greeted us to our amazing waiter Manny; they were fabulous! Now for the food. It was DELICIOUS! We got the baked Mac & Cheese and fried check sandwich... Both were fantastic. Definitely pay this place a visit when in Vegas!

A great restaurant for small groups. The place is small, like 1800 sq feet hey we need your menu small. We went for dinner during a friends bachelor party. Big thanks to all the Yelp reviewers who steered me right. Bacon jam and the oxtail risotto were great. 

The main thing to know about this place is the food is family style. The concept is you order the sides like oxtail risotto, mac n cheese, or the sprouts and suds hash and share with the table. Then you order your protein individually, but you could really share that too. 

Good food, I definitely enjoyed the experience and will go back!

This is a great place downtown. What used to a be part of a rundown no-tell-motel has been transformed into a fantastic dining space. The secret's out, though, so you may have a wait depending on when you stop by. Trust me, it's worth it.

If you can, and the weather's not oppressive, try to sit outside upstairs. It's a nice space, and the bar will keep you hydrated. I was especially impressed with the Angry Tony, with it's use of mezcal.

Food-wise, this is the kind of place where you could eat with your health in mind, but don't: you're gonna deny yourself some good eats. I loved the Devil's eggs, the gyro tacos, and the baked mac and cheese. Service was great, and our guy kept an eye on us throughout the night.

Funky location located off the strip with really great atmosphere when you open the door. This is totally the type of place I would expect to see in Portland, Oregon. The burgers were fantastic as were the veal meatballs. We also ordered the fried chicken skins, which were "different".   The staff was very friendly, helpful and fun.  I'll definitely be going back when I'm in Las Vegas.

This is my kind of place. I love how accessible the Kitchen is from the Fremont Strip, but hidden enough to avoid attracting the buffet line crowd. My group rocked the Bacon Jam, Mushroom Flatbread, Gyro Tacos, Mac & Cheese, and the glazed donut pudding. Everything was fantastic. If I had to choose, I would say that the Bacon Jam and the Donut pudding were the real dinner MVPs.

The rooftop was a great place to unwind from a long day and enjoy cocktails. I don't normally buy cocktails in Vegas, since I'm usually drowning in comped drink tickets. But these cocktails are worth the cash and the stroll off Fremont.
Beets. Burger (order the Brie with bacon jam app to make sure you have extra bacon jam for the burger). Deviled eggs. Had them all and they were awesome.

In a word, phenomenal. Drink selection was outstanding. Had the low & slow, with an awesome spherical ice cube. The get shorty was also really good with a grapefruit twist. Deviled eggs were great, so good we had them twice! The gyro tacos, also a BOMB choice. Flatbread margherita was an awesome choice, the steak, the chicken sandwich, the brownie that gets you super drunk at the end... All around this place is a must go!

Second time here and once again did not disappoint! Felicia was so genuine and sweet, she recommended the Broccoli Crunch which is something you must eat before leaving! My girlfriend loves the tempura green beans and today we also tried the wild mushroom flatbread and I will be dreaming about the pickled tomatoes that top it until I eat it again. Seriously some of the best food in Vegas high quality and super fresh! We can't wait to try the cocoa-espresso NY strip and the baked Mac and cheese! We will come as often as we can!

Great experience at Carson's Kitchen. We split the Turkey Burger and tri-colored cauliflower salad, both were amazing. Also try the fried chicken skins they are addicting.  Excellent lunch, highly recommend.

The food was fantastic and the people and my server were all good vibes. My only complaint is the hostess, actually!! I got the impression that she wanted us to leave based on the wait but when I told her we preferred the rooftop, she attempted to seat us in a cramped corner on the bottom floor at the bar. When reiterating that rooftop was preferred, again I felt like she wanted to dissuade us by saying it would be an additional 20 mins to the 30 we already waited. We were willing to wait, then miraculously there was seating available right at that moment... Seating at 4 tables actually. Then when we left, she didn't make eye contact, but the hostess next to her spoke and gave a happy smile. So I acknowledged how I appreciated her for actually speaking. All in all, great food and service. Only The hostess had an off vibe.

Ridiculously good food and excellent service. I had the snapper, rainbow cauliflower and the donut bread pudding. All three were excellent. I also sat at the bar and watched the staff prepare various dishes and they are efficient and genuinely seem to be having a good time. The servers were friendly and the whole vibe was effortlessly cool with the swear jar and the receipt book (an actual book) that you can sign your name in. I'm just visiting Vegas, but it's definitely on my list when I come back!

An exceptional meal....

We took in a late lunch/early dinner or as Janeane Garofalo said it best, "Lupper or Linner"

At 3pm the restaurant was completely vacant on a Thursday

We had the opportunity to meet the staff and crew on a more intimate level.  They had just come off of introducing new items to their menu and Brandon and Lina were very gracious 

Our picks to share for two included: the deviled eggs, veal meatballs, BLTA salad, black rice risotto with oxtail, wild mushroom flatbread, tomato bisque and the donut bread pudding for dessert

Great attention to details in each dish for flavors and presentation

It was a joy to have the staff's attention as we can imagine the chaos the line endures at peak times

Highly recommend Carson to everyone who wants honest food lacking any pretense

This restaurant is just fantastic! It's one of my favorites. I recently went here with a group of 9 others for a birthday, and it could t have been better. The staff is kind, personable, and knowledgeable; and the ambiance is fun and lively. With menu pickings like bacon jam, seasoned crispy chicken skins with smoked honey, jerk turkey burger, and glazed donut bread pudding it's hard to pick just one item off the menu that stands out. 

Definitely a must for anyone!

One word.. BaconJam.

Our server Felicia was just about the nicest person I've ever had as a server... Full of information, even though she wouldn't share the exact recipe for bacon jam. (i forgive you)
